text: Blessed is the man that doth not walk in the counsel of the wicked, nor stand in the way of sinners, nor sit in the seat of the scornful.
speaker: Narrator

text: But his delight is in the law of the Lord, and in his law doth he meditate day and night.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he shall be like a tree planted by the rivers of waters, that will bring forth her fruits in due season: whose leaf shall not fade: so whatsoever he shall do, shall prosper.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked are not so, but as the chaff, which the wind driveth away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the wicked shall not stand in the judgment, nor sinners in the assembly of the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord knoweth the way of the righteous, and the way of the wicked shall perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why do the heathen rage, and the people murmur in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text: The kings of the earth band themselves, and the Princes are assembled together against the Lord, and against his Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let us break their bands, and cast their cords from us.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he that dwelleth in the heaven shall laugh: the Lord shall have them in derision.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shall he speak unto them in his wrath, and vex them in his sore displeasure, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Even I have set my King upon Zion mine holy mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will declare the decree: that is, the Lord hath said unto me, Thou art my son; this day have I begotten thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ask of me, and I shall give thee the heathen for thine inheritance, and the ends of the earth for thy possession.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt crush them with a scepter of iron, and break them in pieces like a potterâ€™s vessel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be wise now therefore, ye kings: be learned ye judges of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Serve the Lord in fear, and rejoice in trembling.
speaker: Narrator

text: Kiss the Son, lest he be angry, and ye perish in the way, when his wrath shall suddenly burn. Blessed are all that trust in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, how are mine adversaries increased? how many rise against me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Many say to my soul, There is no help for him in God. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou Lord art a buckler for me, my glory, and the lifter up of mine head.
speaker: Narrator

text: I did call unto the Lord with my voice, and he heard me out of his holy mountain. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: I laid me down and slept, and rose up again: for the Lord sustained me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will not be afraid for ten thousand of the people, that should beset me round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, arise: help me, my God: for thou hast smitten all mine enemies upon the cheekbone: thou hast broken the teeth of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: Salvation belongeth unto the Lord, and thy blessing is upon thy people. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear me when I call, O God of my righteousness: thou hast set me at liberty, when I was in distress: have mercy upon me, and hearken unto my prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: O ye sons of men, how long will ye turn my glory into shame, loving vanity, and seeking lies? Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: For be ye sure that the Lord hath chosen to himself a godly man, the Lord will hear when I call unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tremble and sin not: examine your own heart upon your bed, and be still. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Offer the sacrifices of righteousness, and trust in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many say, Who will show us any good? but Lord, lift up the light of thy countenance upon us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast given me more joy of heart, than they have had, when their wheat and their wine did abound.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will lay me down, and also sleep in peace: for thou, Lord, only makest me dwell in safety.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear my words, O Lord: understand my meditation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hearken unto the voice of my cry, my king and my God: for unto thee do I pray.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear my voice in the morning, O Lord: for in the morning will I direct me unto thee, and I will wait.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou art not a God that loveth wickedness, neither shall evil dwell with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: The foolish shall not stand in thy sight: for thou hatest all them that work iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt destroy them that speak lies: the Lord will abhor the bloody man and deceitful.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will come into thine house in the multitude of thy mercy: and in thy fear will I worship toward thine holy Temple.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lead me, O Lord, in thy righteousness, because of mine enemies: make thy way plain before my face.
speaker: Narrator

text: For no constancy is in their mouth: within they are very corruption: their throat is an open sepulcher, and they flatter with their tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text: Destroy them, O God, let them fall from their counsels: cast them out for the multitude of their iniquities, because they have rebelled against thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And let all them that trust in thee, rejoice and triumph forever, and cover thou them: and let them that love thy name, rejoice in thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou Lord, wilt bless the righteous, and with favor wilt compass him, as with a shield.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, rebuke me not in thine anger, neither chastise me in thy wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have mercy upon me, O Lord, for I am weak: O Lord heal me, for my bones are vexed.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul is also sore troubled: but Lord, how long wilt thou delay?
speaker: Narrator

text: Return, O Lord: deliver my soul: save me for thy mercyâ€™s sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in death there is no remembrance of thee: in the grave who shall praise thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: I fainted in my mourning: I cause my bed every night to swim, and water my couch with my tears.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine eye is dimmed for despite, and sunk in because of all mine enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Away from me all ye workers of iniquity: for the Lord hath heard the voice of my weeping.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord hath heard my petition: the Lord will receive my prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: All mine enemies shall be confounded and sore vexed: they shall be turned back, and put to shame suddenly.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord my God, in thee I put my trust: save me from all that persecute me, and deliver me,
speaker: Narrator

text: Lest he devour my soul like a lion, and tear it in pieces, while there is none to help.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord my God, if I have done this thing, if there be any wickedness in mine hands,
speaker: Narrator

text: If I have rewarded evil unto him that had peace with me, (yea I have delivered him that vexed me without cause.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Then let the enemies persecute my soul, and take it: yea, let him tread my life down upon the earth, and lay mine honor in the dust. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, O Lord, in thy wrath, and lift up thyself against the rage of mine enemies, and awake for me according to the judgment that thou hast appointed.
speaker: Narrator

text: So shall the congregation of the people compass thee about: for their sakes therefore return on high.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord shall judge the people: judge thou me, O Lord, according to my righteousness, and according to mine innocency that is in me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Oh let the malice of the wicked come to an end: but guide thou the just: for the righteous God trieth the hearts and reins.
speaker: Narrator

text: My defense is in God, who preserveth the upright in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: God judgeth the righteous, and him that contemneth God, every day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Except he turn, he hath whet his sword: he hath bent his bow, and made it ready.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath also prepared him deadly weapons: he will ordain his arrows for them that persecute me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, he shall travail with wickedness: for he hath conceived mischief, but he shall bring forth a lie.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath made a pit, and dug it, and is fallen into the pit that he made.
speaker: Narrator

text: His mischief shall return upon his own head, and his cruelty shall fall upon his own pate.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will praise the Lord according to his righteousness, and will sing praise to the Name of the Lord most high.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord our Lord, how excellent is thy Name in all the world! which hast set thy glory above the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings hast thou ordained strength, because of thine enemies, that thou mightest still the enemy and the avenger.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I behold thine heavens, even the works of thy fingers, the moon and the stars, which thou hast ordained,
speaker: Narrator

text: What is man, say I, that thou art mindful of him? and the son of man that thou visitest him?
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou hast made him a little lower than God, and crowned him with glory and worship.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast made him to have dominion in the works of thine hands, thou hast put all things under his feet:
speaker: Narrator

text: All sheep and oxen: yea, and the beasts of the field:
speaker: Narrator

text: The fowls of the air, and the fish of the sea, and that which passeth through the paths of the seas.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord our Lord, how excellent is thy Name in all the world!
speaker: Narrator

text: I will praise the Lord with my whole heart: I will speak of all thy marvelous works.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will be glad, and rejoice in thee: I will sing praise to thy Name, O most High.
speaker: Narrator

text: For that mine enemies are turned back: they shall fall and perish at thy presence.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou hast maintained my right and my cause: thou art set in the throne, and judgest right.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast rebuked the heathen: thou hast destroyed the wicked: thou hast put out their name forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: O enemy, destructions are come to a perpetual end, and thou hast destroyed the cities: their memorial is perished with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord shall sit forever: he hath prepared his throne for judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he shall judge the world in righteousness, and shall judge the people with equity.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord also will be a refuge for the poor, a refuge in due time, even in affliction.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they that know thy Name, will trust in thee: for thou, Lord, hast not failed them that seek thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing praises to the Lord, which dwelleth in Zion: show the people his works.
speaker: Narrator

text: For when he maketh inquisition for blood, he remembereth it, and forgetteth not the complaint of the poor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have mercy upon me, O Lord: consider my trouble which I suffer of them that hate me, thou that liftest me up from the gates of death,
speaker: Narrator

text: That I may show all thy praises within the gates of the daughter of Zion, and rejoice in thy salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heathen are sunken down in the pit that they made: in the net that they hid, is their foot taken.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is known by executing judgment: the wicked is snared in the work of his own hands, Higgaion. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked shall turn into hell, and all nations that forget God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the poor shall not be always forgotten: the hope of the afflicted shall not perish forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Up Lord: let not man prevail: let the heathen be judged in thy sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Put them in fear, O Lord, that the heathen may know that they are but men. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why standest thou far off, O Lord, and hidest thee in due time, even in affliction?
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked with pride doth persecute the poor; let them be taken in the crafts that they have imagined.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the wicked hath made boast of his own heartâ€™s desire, and the covetous blesseth himself, he contemneth the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked is so proud, that he seeketh not for God: he thinketh always, There is no God.
speaker: Narrator

text: His ways always prosper: thy judgments are high above his sight; therefore defieth he all his enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: He saith in his heart, I shall never be moved, nor be in danger.
speaker: Narrator

text: His mouth is full of cursing, and deceit, and fraud; under his tongue is mischief and iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: He lieth in wait in the villages; in the secret places doth he murder the innocent; his eyes are bent against the poor.
speaker: Narrator

text: He lieth in wait secretly, even as a lion in his den; he lieth in wait to spoil the poor; he doth spoil the poor, when he draweth him into his net.
speaker: Narrator

text: He croucheth and boweth; therefore heaps of the poor do fall by his might.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath said in his heart, God hath forgotten, he hideth away his face, and will never see.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, O Lord God, lift up thine hand; forget not the poor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore doth the wicked contemn God? he saith in his heart, Thou wilt not regard.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet thou hast seen it; for thou beholdest mischief and wrong; that thou mayest take it into thine hands; the poor committeth himself unto thee; for thou art the helper of the fatherless.
speaker: Narrator

text: Break thou the arm of the wicked and malicious; search his wickedness, and thou shalt find none.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is King forever and ever; the heathen are destroyed forth of his land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, thou hast heard the desire of the poor; thou preparest their heart; thou bendest thine ear to them,
speaker: Narrator

text: To judge the fatherless and poor, that earthly man cause to fear no more.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the Lord put I my trust; how say ye then to my soul, Flee to your mountain as a bird?
speaker: Narrator

text: For lo, the wicked bend their bow, and make ready their arrows upon the string, that they may secretly shoot at them which are upright in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the foundations are cast down, what hath the righteous done?
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is in his holy palace; the Lordâ€™s throne is in the heaven; his eyes will consider; his eyelids will try the children of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will try the righteous; but the wicked, and him that loveth iniquity, doth his soul hate.
speaker: Narrator

text: Upon the wicked he shall rain snares, fire, and brimstone, and stormy tempest; this is the portion of their cup.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the righteous Lord loveth righteousness: his countenance doth behold the just.
speaker: Narrator

text: Help Lord, for there is not a godly man left: for the faithful are failed from among the children of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: They speak deceitfully every one with his neighbor, flattering with their lips, and speak with a double heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord cut off all flattering lips, and the tongue that speaketh proud things:
speaker: Narrator

text: Which have said, With our tongue will we prevail; our lips are our own; who is Lord over us?
speaker: Narrator

text: Now for the oppression of the needy, and for the sighs of the poor, I will up, saith the Lord, and will set at liberty him, whom the wicked hath [snared].
speaker: Narrator

text: The words of the Lord are pure words, as the silver, tried in a furnace of earth, fined sevenfold.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou wilt keep them, O Lord; thou wilt preserve him from this generation forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked walk on every side; when they are exalted, it is a shame for the sons of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: How long wilt thou forget me, O Lord, forever? how long wilt thou hide thy face from me?
speaker: Narrator

text: How long shall I take counsel within myself having weariness daily in mine heart? how long shall mine enemy be exalted above me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, and hear me, O Lord my God: lighten mine eyes, that I sleep not in death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lest mine enemy say, I have prevailed against him: and they that afflict me, rejoice, when I slide.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I trust in thy mercy: mine heart shall rejoice in thy salvation; I will sing to the Lord, because he hath dealt lovingly with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fool hath said in his heart, There is no God: they have corrupted, and done an abominable work: there is none that doeth good.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord looked down from heaven upon the children of men, to see if there were any that would understand, and seek God.
speaker: Narrator

text: All are gone out of the way: they are all corrupt: there is none that doeth good, no not one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not all the workers of iniquity know that they eat up my people, as they eat bread? they call not upon the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: There they shall be taken with fear, because God is in the generation of the just.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have made a mock at the counsel of the poor, because the Lord is his trust.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh give salvation unto Israel out of Zion: when the Lord turneth the captivity of his people, then Jacob shall rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.
Note that of Psalm 14:5-7, which are put into the common translation, and may seem unto some to be left out in this, are not in the same Psalm in the Hebrew text, but rather are put in more fully to express the manners of the wicked, and are gathered out of Psalms 5, 10, 36, 140; Isa. 59, and are alleged by S. Paul, and placed together in Romans 3.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, who shall dwell in thy Tabernacle? who shall rest in thine holy Mountain?
speaker: Narrator

text: He that walketh uprightly and worketh righteousness, and speaketh the truth in his heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that slandereth not with his tongue, nor doeth evil to his neighbor, nor receiveth a false report against his neighbor.
speaker: Narrator

text: In whose eyes a vile person is contemned, but he honoreth them that fear the Lord: he that sweareth to his own hindrance and changeth not.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that giveth not his money unto usury, nor taketh reward against the innocent: he that doeth these things, shall never be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Preserve me, O GOD: for in thee do I trust.
speaker: Narrator

text: O my soul, thou hast said unto the Lord, Thou art my Lord: my well doing extendeth not to thee,
speaker: Narrator

text: But to the Saints that are in the earth, and to the excellent: all my delight is in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sorrows of them, that offer to another god, shall be multiplied: their offerings of blood will I not offer, neither make mention of their names with my lips.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is the portion of mine inheritance and of my cup: thou shalt maintain my lot.
speaker: Narrator

text: The lines are fallen unto me in pleasant places: yea, I have a fair heritage.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will praise the Lord, who hath given me counsel: my reins also teach me in the nights.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have set the Lord always before me: for he is at my right hand: therefore I shall not slide.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore mine heart is glad, and my tongue rejoiceth: my flesh also doth rest in hope.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou wilt not leave my soul in the grave: neither wilt thou suffer thine holy One to see corruption.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou wilt show me the path of life: in thy presence is the fullness of joy: and at thy right hand there are pleasures forevermore.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear the right, O Lord, consider my cry: hearken unto my prayer of lips unfeigned.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let my sentence come forth from thy presence, and let thine eyes behold equity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast proved and visited mine heart in the night: thou hast tried me, and foundest nothing: for I was purposed that my mouth should not offend.
speaker: Narrator

text: Concerning the works of men, by the words of thy lips I kept me from the paths of the cruel man.
speaker: Narrator

text: Stay my steps in thy paths, that my feet do not slide.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have called upon thee: surely thou wilt hear me, O God: incline thine ear to me, and hearken unto my words.
speaker: Narrator

text: Show thy marvelous mercies: thou that art the Savior of them that trust in thee, from such as resist thy right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep me as the apple of the eye: hide me under the shadow of thy wings,
speaker: Narrator

text: From the wicked that oppress me, from mine enemies, which compass me round about for my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are enclosed in their own fat, and they have spoken proudly with their mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have compassed us now in our steps: they have set their eyes to bring down to the ground:
speaker: Narrator

text: Like as a lion that is greedy of prey, and as it were a Lionâ€™s whelp lurking in secret places.
speaker: Narrator

text: Up Lord, disappoint him: cast him down: deliver my soul from the wicked with thy sword,
speaker: Narrator

text: From men by thine hand, O Lord, from men of the world, who have their portion in this life, whose bellies thou fillest with thine hid treasure: their children have enough, and leave the rest of their substance for their children.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will behold thy face in righteousness, and when I wake, I shall be satisfied with thine image.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will love thee dearly, O Lord my strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is my rock, and my fortress, and he that delivereth me, my God and my strength: in him will I trust, my shield, the horn also of my salvation, and my refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will call upon the Lord, which is worthy to be praised: so shall I be safe from mine enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sorrows of death compassed me, and the floods of wickedness made me afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sorrows of the grave have compassed me about: the snares of death overtook me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But in my trouble did I call upon the Lord, and cried unto my God: he heard my voice out of his Temple, and my cry did come before him, even into his ears.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the earth trembled and quaked: the foundations also of the mountains moved and shook, because he was angry.
speaker: Narrator

text: Smoke went out at his nostrils, and a consuming fire out of his mouth: coals were kindled thereat.
speaker: Narrator

text: He bowed the heavens also and came down, and darkness was under his feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he rode upon Cherub, and did fly, and he came flying upon the wings of the wind.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made darkness his secret place, and his pavilion round about him, even darkness of waters, and clouds of the air.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the brightness of his presence his clouds passed, hailstones and coals of fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord also thundered in the heaven, and the Highest gave his voice, hailstones and coals of fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he sent out his arrows and scattered them, and he increased lightnings and destroyed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the channels of waters were seen, and the foundations of the world were discovered at thy rebuking, O Lord, at the blasting of the breath of thy nostrils.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath sent down from above and taken me: he hath drawn me out of many waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath delivered me from my strong enemy, and from them which hate me: for they were too strong for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: They prevented me in the day of my calamity: but the Lord was my stay.
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought me forth also into a large place: he delivered me because he favored me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord rewarded me according to my righteousness: according to the pureness of mine hand he recompensed me:
speaker: Narrator

text: Because I kept the ways of the Lord, and did not wickedly against my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all his laws were before me, and I did not cast away his commandments from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was upright also with him, and have kept me from my wickedness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the Lord rewarded me according to my righteousness, and according to the pureness of mine hands in his sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: With the godly thou wilt show thyself godly: with the upright man thou wilt show thyself upright.
speaker: Narrator

text: With the pure thou wilt show thyself pure, and with the froward thou wilt show thyself froward.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus thou wilt save the poor people, and wilt cast down to proud looks.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely thou wilt light my candle: the Lord my God will lighten my darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text: For by thee I have broken through an host, and by my God I have leaped over a wall.
speaker: Narrator

text: The way of God is uncorrupt: the word of the Lord is tried in the fire: he is a shield to all that trust in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For who is God besides the Lord? and who is mighty save our God?
speaker: Narrator

text: God girdeth me with strength, and maketh my way upright.
speaker: Narrator

text: He maketh my feet like hindâ€™s feet, and setteth me upon mine high places.
speaker: Narrator

text: He teacheth mine hands to fight: so that a bow of brass is broken with mine arms.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast also given me the shield of thy salvation, and thy right hand hath stayed me, and thy lovingkindness hath caused me to increase.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast enlarged my steps under me, and my heels have not slid.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have pursued mine enemies, and taken them, and have not turned again till I had consumed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have wounded them, that they were not able to rise, they are fallen under my feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou hast girded me with strength to battle: them that rose against me, thou hast subdued under me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou hast given me the necks of mine enemies, that I might destroy them that hate me.
speaker: Narrator

text: They cried, but there was none to save them, even unto the Lord, but he answered them not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I did beat them small as the dust before the wind: I did tread them flat as the clay in the streets.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast delivered me from the contentions of the people: thou hast made me the head of the heathen, a people, whom I have not known, shall serve me.
speaker: Narrator

text: As soon as they hear they shall obey me: the strangers shall be in subjection to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Strangers shall shrink away, and fear in their pure chambers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the Lord live, and blessed be my strength, and the God of my salvation be exalted.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is God that giveth me power to avenge me, and subdued the people under me.
speaker: Narrator

text: O my deliverer from mine enemies, even thou hast set me up from those that rose against me; thou hast delivered me from the cruel man.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I will praise thee, O Lord, among the nations, and will sing unto thy Name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Great deliverances giveth he unto his king, and showeth mercy to his anointed, even to David, and to his seed forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heavens declare the glory of God, and the firmament showeth the work of his hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Day unto day uttereth the same, and night unto night teacheth knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is no speech nor language, where their voice is not heard.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their line is gone forth through all the earth, and their words into the ends of the world: in them hath he set a tabernacle for the Sun.
speaker: Narrator

text: Which cometh forth as a bridegroom out of his chamber, and rejoiceth like a mighty man to run his race.
speaker: Narrator

text: His going out is from the end of the heaven, and his compass is unto the ends of the same, and none is hid from the heat thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Law of the Lord is perfect, converting the soul: the testimony of the Lord is sure, and giveth wisdom unto the simple.
speaker: Narrator

text: The statutes of the Lord are right, and rejoice the heart, the commandment of the Lord is pure, and giveth light unto the eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fear of the Lord is clean, and endureth forever: the judgments of the Lord are truth: they are righteous altogether,
speaker: Narrator

text: And more to be desired than gold, yea, than much fine gold: sweeter also than honey, and the honeycomb.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover by them is thy servant made circumspect, and in keeping of them there is great reward.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who can understand his faults? cleanse me from secret faults.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep thy servant also from presumptuous sins: let them not reign over me: so shall I be upright, and made clean from much wickedness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the words of my mouth, and the meditation of mine heart be acceptable in thy sight, O Lord my strength, and my redeemer.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord hear thee in the day of trouble: the Name of the God of Jacob defend thee:
speaker: Narrator

text: Send thee help from the Sanctuary, and strengthen thee out of Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let him remember all thine offerings, and turn thy burnt offerings into ashes. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And grant thee according to thine heart, and fulfill all thy purpose:
speaker: Narrator

text: That we may rejoice in thy salvation, and set up the banner in the Name of our God, when the Lord shall perform all thy petitions.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now know I that the Lord will help his anointed, and will hear him from his Sanctuary, by the mighty help of his right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some trust in chariots, and some in horses: but we will remember the Name of the Lord our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are brought down and fallen, but we are risen, and stand upright.
speaker: Narrator

text: Save Lord: Let the King hear us in the day that we call.
speaker: Narrator

text: The King shall rejoice in thy strength, O Lord: yea how greatly shall he rejoice in thy salvation?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast given him his heartâ€™s desire, and hast not denied him the request of his lips. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou didst prevent him with liberal blessings, and didst set a crown of pure gold upon his head.
speaker: Narrator

text: He asked life of thee, and thou gavest him a long life forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: His glory is great in thy salvation: dignity and honor hast thou laid upon him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou hast set him as blessings forever: thou hast made him glad with the joy of thy countenance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because the king trusteth in the Lord, and in the mercy of the most high, he shall not slide.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thine hand shall find out all thine enemies, and thy right hand shall find out them that hate thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt make them like a fiery oven in time of thine anger: the Lord shall destroy them in his wrath, and the fire shall devour them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their fruit shalt thou destroy from the earth, and their seed from the children of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they intended evil against thee, and imagined mischief, but they shall not prevail.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore shalt thou put them apart, and the strings of thy bow shalt thou make ready against their faces.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be thou exalted, O Lord, in thy strength: so will we sing and praise thy power.
speaker: Narrator

text: My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me, and art so far from mine health, and from the words of my roaring?
speaker: Narrator

text: O my God, I cry by day, but thou hearest not: and by night, but have no audience.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou art holy, and dost inhabit the praises of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our fathers trusted in thee: they trusted, and thou didst deliver them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They called upon thee, and were delivered: they trusted in thee, and were not confounded.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I am a worm, and not a man: a shame of men, and the contempt of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: All they that see me, have me in derision: they make a mow and nod the head, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: He trusted in the Lord, let him deliver him: let him save him, seeing he loveth him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou didst draw me out of the womb: thou gavest me hope, even at my motherâ€™s breasts.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was cast upon thee, even from the womb: thou art my God from my motherâ€™s belly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be not far from me, because trouble is near: for there is none to help me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many young bulls have compassed me: mighty bulls of Bashan have closed me about.
speaker: Narrator

text: They gape upon me with their mouths, as a ramping and roaring lion.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am like water poured out, and all my bones are out of joint: mine heart is like wax: it is molten in the midst of my bowels.
speaker: Narrator

text: My strength is dried up like a potsherd, and my tongue cleaveth to my jaws, and thou hast brought me into the dust of death.
speaker: Narrator

text: For dogs have compassed me, and the assembly of the wicked have enclosed me: they pierced mine hands and my feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: I may tell all my bones, yet they behold, and look upon me.
speaker: Narrator

text: They part my garments among them, and cast lots upon my vesture.
speaker: Narrator

text: But be not thou far off, O Lord, my strength: hasten to help me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver my soul from the sword: my desolate soul from the power of the dog.
speaker: Narrator

text: Save me from the lionâ€™s mouth, and answer me in saving me from the horns of the unicorns.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will declare thy Name unto my brethren: in the midst of the Congregation will I praise thee, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the Lord, ye that fear him: magnify ye him, all the seed of Jacob, and fear ye him all the seed of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he hath not despised nor abhorred the affliction of the poor: neither hath he hid his face from him, but when he called unto him, he heard.
speaker: Narrator

text: My praise shall be of thee in the great Congregation: my vows will I perform before them that fear him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The poor shall eat and be satisfied: they that seek after the Lord, shall praise him: your heart shall live forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the ends of the world shall remember themselves and turn to the Lord, and all the kindreds of the nations shall worship before thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the kingdom is the Lordâ€™s, and he ruleth among the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: All they that be fat in the earth shall eat and worship: all they that go down into the dust, shall bow before him, even he that cannot quicken his own soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their seed shall serve him: it shall be counted unto the Lord for a generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall come and shall declare his righteousness unto a people that shall be born, because he hath done it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is my shepherd, I shall not want.
speaker: Narrator

text: He maketh me to rest in green pasture, and leadeth me by the still waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: He restoreth my soul, and leadeth me in the paths of righteousness for his Nameâ€™s sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, though I should walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil; for thou art with me: thy rod and thy staff, they comfort me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou dost prepare a table before me in the sight of mine adversaries: thou dost anoint mine head with oil, and my cup runneth over.
speaker: Narrator

text: Doubtless kindness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life, and I shall remain a long season in the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The earth is the Lordâ€™s, and all that therein is; the world and they that dwell therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he hath founded it upon the seas; and established it upon the floods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who shall ascend into the mountain of the Lord? and who shall stand in his holy place?
speaker: Narrator

text: Even he that hath innocent hands, and a pure heart; which hath not lifted up his mind unto vanity, nor sworn deceitfully.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall receive a blessing from the Lord, and righteousness from the God of his salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the generation of them that seek him, of them that seek thy face, this is Jacob. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up your heads ye gates, and be ye lifted up ye everlasting doors, and the King of glory shall come in.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is this King of glory? the Lord, strong and mighty, even the Lord mighty in battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up your heads, ye gates, and lift up yourselves ye everlasting doors, and the King of glory shall come in.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is this King of glory? the Lord of hosts, he is the King of glory. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto thee, O Lord, lift I up my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: My God, I trust in thee; let me not be confounded: let not mine enemies rejoice over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all that hope in thee, shall not be ashamed; but let them be confounded, that transgress without cause.
speaker: Narrator

text: Show me thy ways, O Lord, and teach me thy paths.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lead me forth in thy truth, and teach me: for thou art the God of my salvation: in thee do I trust all the day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember, O Lord, thy tender mercies, and thy lovingkindness: for they have been forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember not the sins of my youth, nor my rebellions, but according to thy kindness remember thou me, even for thy goodness sake, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gracious and righteous is the Lord: therefore will he teach sinners in the way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Them that be meek, will he guide in judgment, and teach the humble his way.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the paths of the Lord are mercy and truth unto such as keep his covenant and his testimonies:
speaker: Narrator

text: For thy Nameâ€™s sake, O Lord, be merciful unto mine iniquity, for it is great.
speaker: Narrator

text: What man is he that feareth the Lord? him will he teach the way that he shall choose.
speaker: Narrator

text: His soul shall dwell at ease, and his seed shall inherit the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: The secret of the Lord is revealed to them that fear him: and his Covenant to give them understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine eyes are ever toward the Lord: for he will bring my feet out of the net.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn thy face unto me, and have mercy upon me: for I am desolate and poor.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sorrows of mine heart are enlarged: draw me out of my troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look upon mine affliction and my travail, and forgive all my sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold mine enemies, for they are many, and they hate me with cruel hatred.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep my soul and deliver me: let me not be confounded: for I trust in thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let mine uprightness and equity preserve me; for mine hope is in thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver Israel, O God, out of all his troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text: Judge me, O Lord, for I have walked in mine innocency: my trust hath been also in the Lord: therefore shall I not slide.
speaker: Narrator

text: Prove me, O Lord, and try me: examine my reins, and mine heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thy lovingkindness is before mine eyes: therefore have I walked in thy truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have not haunted with vain persons, neither kept company with the dissemblers.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have hated the assembly of the evil, and have not companied with the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will wash mine hands in innocency, O Lord, and compass thine altar,
speaker: Narrator

text: That I may declare with the voice of thanksgiving, and set forth all thy wondrous works.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, I have loved the habitation of thine house, and the place where thine honor dwelleth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gather not my soul with the sinners, nor my life with the bloody men:
speaker: Narrator

text: In whose hand is wickedness, and their right hand is full of bribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will walk in mine innocency: redeem me therefore, and be merciful unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: My foot standeth in uprightness: I will praise thee, O Lord, in the Congregations.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is my light and my salvation, whom shall I fear? the Lord is the strength of my life, of whom shall I be afraid?
speaker: Narrator

text: When the wicked, even mine enemies and my foes came upon me to eat up my flesh, they stumbled and fell.
speaker: Narrator

text: Though an host pitched against me, mine heart should not be afraid: though war be raised against me, I will trust in this.
speaker: Narrator

text: One thing have I desired of the Lord, that I will require, even that I may dwell in the house of the Lord all the days of my life, to behold the beauty of the Lord, and to visit his Temple.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in the time of trouble he shall hide me in his Tabernacle: in the secret place of his pavilion shall he hide me, and set me up upon a rock.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now shall he lift up mine head above mine enemies round about me: therefore will I offer in his Tabernacle sacrifices of joy: I will sing and praise the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hearken unto my voice, O Lord, when I cry: have mercy also upon me and hear me.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou saidest, Seek ye my face, mine heart answered unto thee, O Lord, I will seek thy face.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hide not therefore thy face from me, nor cast thy servant away in displeasure: thou hast been my succor, leave me not, neither forsake me, O God of my salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Though my father and my mother should forsake me, yet the Lord will gather me up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Teach me thy way, O Lord, and lead me in a right path, because of mine enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give me not unto the lust of mine adversaries: for there are false witnesses risen up against me, and such as speak cruelly.
speaker: Narrator

text: I should have fainted, except I had believed to see the goodness of the Lord in the land of the living.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hope in the Lord: be strong, and he shall comfort thine heart, and trust in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto thee, O Lord, do I cry: O my strength, be not deaf toward me, lest if thou answer me not, I be like them that go down into the pit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear the voice of my petitions, when I cry unto thee, when I hold up my hands toward thine holy Oracle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Draw me not away with the wicked, and with the workers of iniquity: which speak friendly to their neighbors, when malice is in their hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Reward them according to their deeds, and according to the wickedness of their inventions: recompense them after the work of their hands: render them their reward.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they reward not the works of the Lord, nor the operation of his hands: therefore break them down, and build them not up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praised be the Lord, for he hath heard the voice of my petitions.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is my strength and my shield: mine heart trusted in him, and I was helped: therefore mine heart shall rejoice, and with my song will I praise him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is their strength, and he is the strength of the deliverances of his anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Save thy people, and bless thine inheritance: feed them also, and exalt them forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give unto the Lord, ye sons of the mighty, give unto the Lord glory and strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give unto the Lord glory due unto his Name: worship the Lord in the glorious Sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of the Lord is upon the waters: the God of glory maketh it to thunder: the Lord is upon the great waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of the Lord is mighty: the voice of the Lord is glorious.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of the Lord breaketh the cedars: yea, the Lord breaketh the cedars of Lebanon.
speaker: Narrator

text: He maketh them also to leap like a calf: Lebanon also and Shirion like a young unicorn.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of the Lord divideth the flames of fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of the Lord maketh the wilderness to tremble: the Lord maketh the wilderness of Kadesh to tremble.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of the Lord maketh the hinds to calve, and discovereth the forests: therefore in his Temple doth every man speak of his glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord sitteth upon the floods, and the Lord doth remain King forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord shall give strength unto his people: the Lord shall bless his people with peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will magnify thee, O Lord: thou hast exalted me, and hast not made my foes to rejoice over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord my God, I cried unto thee, and thou hast restored me.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, thou hast brought up my soul out of the grave: thou hast revived me from them that go down into the pit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing praises unto the Lord, ye his Saints, and give thanks before the remembrance of his Holiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he endureth but a while in his anger: but in his favor is life: weeping may abide at evening, but joy cometh in the morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in my prosperity I said, I shall never be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou Lord of thy goodness hadst made my mountain to stand strong: but thou didst hide thy face, and I was troubled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then cried I unto thee, O Lord, and prayed to my Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: What profit is there in my blood, when I go down to the pit! shall the dust give thanks unto thee? or shall it declare thy truth?
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, O Lord, and have mercy upon me: Lord, be thou mine helper.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast turned my mourning into joy: thou hast loosed my sack, and girded me with gladness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore shall my tongue praise thee and not cease: O Lord my God, I will give thanks unto thee forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: In thee, O Lord, have I put my trust: let me never be confounded: deliver me in thy righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bow down thine ear to me: make haste to deliver me: be unto me a strong rock, and an house of defense to save me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou art my rock and my fortress: therefore for thy Nameâ€™s sake direct me and guide me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Draw me out of the net, that they have laid privily for me: for thou art my strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: Into thine hand I commend my spirit: for thou hast redeemed me, O Lord God of truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have hated them that give themselves to deceitful vanities: for I trust in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will be glad and rejoice in thy mercy: for thou hast seen my trouble: thou hast known my soul in adversities,
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou hast not shut me up in the hand of the enemy, but hast set my feet at large.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have mercy upon me, O Lord: for I am in trouble: mine eye, my soul and my belly are consumed with grief.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my life is wasted with heaviness, and my years with mourning: my strength faileth for my pain, and my bones are consumed.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was a reproach among all mine enemies, but specially among my neighbors: and a fear to mine acquaintance, who seeing me in the street, fled from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am forgotten as a dead man out of mind: I am like a broken vessel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have heard the railing of great men: fear was on every side, while they conspired together against me, and consulted to take my life.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I trusted in thee, O Lord: I said, Thou art my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: My times are in thine hand: deliver me from the hand of mine enemies, and from them that persecute me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make thy face to shine upon thy servant: and save me through thy mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let me not be confounded, O Lord: for I have called upon thee: let the wicked be put to confusion, and to silence in the grave.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the lying lips be made dumb, which cruelly, proudly, and spitefully speak against the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: How great is thy goodness, which thou hast laid up for them that fear thee! and done to them that trust in thee, even before the sons of men!
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou dost hide them privily in thy presence from the pride of men: thou keepest them secretly in thy Tabernacle from the strife of tongues.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be the Lord: for he hath showed his marvelous kindness toward me in a strong city.
speaker: Narrator

text: Though I said in mine haste, I am cast out of thy sight, yet thou heardest the voice of my prayer, when I cried unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Love ye the Lord all his Saints: for the Lord preserveth the faithful, and rewardeth abundantly the proud doer.
speaker: Narrator

text: All ye that trust in the Lord, be strong, and he shall establish your heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is he whose wickedness is forgiven, and whose sin is covered.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is the man, unto whom the Lord imputeth not iniquity, and in whose spirit there is no guile.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I held my tongue, my bones consumed, or when I roared all the day,
speaker: Narrator

text: (For thine hand is heavy upon me day and night: and my moisture is turned into the drought of Summer. Selah.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I acknowledged my sin unto thee, neither hid I mine iniquity: for I thought, I will confess against myself my wickedness unto the Lord, and thou forgavest the punishment of my sin. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore shall everyone that is godly, make his prayer unto thee in a time, when thou mayest be found: surely in the flood of great waters they shall not come near him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou art my secret place: thou preservest me from trouble: thou compassest me about with joyful deliverance. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will instruct thee, and teach thee in the way that thou shalt go, and I will guide thee with mine eye.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be ye not like an horse, or like a mule which understand not: whose mouths thou dost bind with bit and bridle, lest they come near thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many sorrows shall come to the wicked: but he that trusteth in the Lord, mercy shall compass him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be glad ye righteous, and rejoice in the Lord, and be joyful all ye, that are upright in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoice in the Lord, O ye righteous: for it becometh upright men to be thankful.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the Lord with harp: sing unto him with viol and instrument of ten strings.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing unto him a new song: sing cheerfully with a loud voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the word of the Lord is righteous, and all his works are faithful.
speaker: Narrator

text: He loveth righteousness and judgment: the earth is full of the goodness of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: By the word of the Lord were the heavens made, and all the host of them by the breath of his mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gathereth the waters of the sea together as upon an heap, and layeth up the depths in his treasures.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let all the earth fear the Lord: let all them that dwell in the world, fear him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he spake, and it was done: he commanded, and it stood.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord breaketh the counsel of the heathen, and bringeth to nought the devices of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: The counsel of the Lord shall stand forever, and the thoughts of his heart throughout all ages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is that nation, whose God is the Lord: even the people that he hath chosen for his inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord looketh down from heaven, and beholdeth all the children of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the habitation of his dwelling, he beholdeth all them that dwell in the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He fashioneth their hearts every one, and understandeth all their works.
speaker: Narrator

text: The King is not saved by the multitude of an host, neither is the mighty man delivered by great strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: A horse is a vain help, and shall not deliver any by his great strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the eye of the Lord is upon them that fear him, and upon them that trust in his mercy,
speaker: Narrator

text: To deliver their souls from death, and to preserve them in famine.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our soul waiteth for the Lord: for he is our help and our shield.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely our heart shall rejoice in him, because we trusted in his holy Name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let thy mercy, O Lord, be upon us, as we trusted in thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will always give thanks unto the Lord: his praise shall be in my mouth continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul shall glory in the Lord: the humble shall hear it and be glad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye the Lord with me, and let us magnify his Name together.
speaker: Narrator

text: I sought the Lord, and he heard me: yea, he delivered me out of all my fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall look unto him, and run to him: and their faces shall not be ashamed, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: This poor man cried, and the Lord heard him, and saved him out of all his troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Angel of the Lord pitched round about them, that fear him, and delivereth them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Taste ye and see, how gracious the Lord is: blessed is the man that trusteth in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fear the Lord ye his Saints: for nothing wanteth to them that fear him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The lions do lack and suffer hunger, but they which seek the Lord, shall want nothing that is good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come children, hearken unto me: I will teach you the fear of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: What man is he that desireth life, and loveth long days for to see good?
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep thy tongue from evil, and thy lips, that they speak no guile.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eschew evil and do good: seek peace and follow after it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The eyes of the Lord are upon the righteous, and his ears are open unto their cry.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the face of the Lord is against them that do evil, to cut off their remembrance from the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous cry, and the Lord heareth them, and delivereth them out of all their troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is near unto them that are of a contrite heart, and will save such as be afflicted in spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Great are the troubles of the righteous: but the Lord delivereth him out of them all.
speaker: Narrator

text: He keepeth all his bones: not one of them is broken.
speaker: Narrator

text: But malice shall slay the wicked: and they that hate the righteous, shall perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord redeemeth the souls of his servants: and none that trust in him, shall perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Plead thou my cause, O Lord, with them that strive with me: fight thou against them that fight against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lay hand upon the shield and buckler, and stand up for my help.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bring out also the spear, and stop the way against them that persecute me, say unto my soul, I am thy salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be confounded and put to shame, that seek after my soul: let them be turned back, and brought to confusion, that imagine mine hurt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be as chaff before the wind, and let the Angel of the Lord scatter them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let their way be dark and slippery: and let the Angel of the Lord persecute them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For without cause they have hid the pit and their net for me: without cause have they dug a pit for my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let destruction come upon him at unawares, and let his net, that he hath laid privily, take him: let him fall into the same destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then my soul shall be joyful in the Lord: it shall rejoice in his salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: All my bones shall say, Lord, who is like unto thee, which deliverest the poor from him, that is too strong for him! yea, the poor and him that is in misery, from him that spoileth him!
speaker: Narrator

text: Cruel witnesses did rise up: they asked of me things that I knew not.
speaker: Narrator

text: They rewarded me evil for good, to have spoiled my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet I, when they were sick, I was clothed with a sack: I humbled my soul with fasting: and my prayer was turned upon my bosom.
speaker: Narrator

text: I behaved myself as to my friend, or as to my brother: I humbled myself, mourning as one that bewaileth his mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: But in mine adversity they rejoiced, and gathered themselves together: the abjects assembled themselves against me, and I knew not: they tare me, and ceased not,
speaker: Narrator

text: With the false scoffers at banquets, gnashing their teeth against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, how long wilt thou behold this? deliver my soul from their tumult, even my desolate soul from the lions.
speaker: Narrator

text: So will I give thee thanks in a great Congregation: I will praise thee among much people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let not them that are mine enemies unjustly rejoice over me, neither let them wink with the eye, that hate me without a cause.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they speak not as friends: but they imagine deceitful words against the quiet of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they gaped on me with their mouths, saying, Aha, aha, our eye hath seen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast seen it, O Lord: keep not silence: be not far from me, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise and wake to my judgment, even to my cause, my God, and my Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Judge me, O Lord my God, according to thy righteousness, and let them not rejoice over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them not say in their hearts, O our soul rejoice: neither let them say, We have devoured him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be confounded, and put to shame together, that rejoice at mine hurt: let them be clothed with confusion and shame, that lift up themselves against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But let them be joyful and glad, that love my righteousness: yea, let them say always, Let the Lord be magnified, which loveth the prosperity of his servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: And my tongue shall utter thy righteousness, and thy praise every day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wickedness saith to the wicked man, even in mine heart, that there is no fear of God before his eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he flattereth himself in his own eyes, while his iniquity is found worthy to be hated.
speaker: Narrator

text: The words of his mouth are iniquity and deceit: he hath left off to understand and to do good.
speaker: Narrator

text: He imagineth mischief upon his bed: he setteth himself upon a way, that is not good, and doth not abhor evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy mercy, O Lord, reacheth unto the heavens, and thy faithfulness unto the clouds.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy righteousness is like the mighty mountains: thy judgments are like a great deep: thou Lord, dost save man and beast.
speaker: Narrator

text: How excellent is thy mercy, O God! therefore the children of men trust under the shadow of thy wings.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall be satisfied with the fatness of thine house, and thou shalt give them drink out of the river of thy pleasures.
speaker: Narrator

text: For with thee is the well of life, and in thy light shall we see light.
speaker: Narrator

text: Extend thy loving-kindness unto them that know thee, and thy righteousness unto them that are upright in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let not the foot of pride come against me, and let not the hand of the wicked men move me.
speaker: Narrator

text: There they are fallen that work iniquity: they are cast down, and shall not be able to rise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fret not thyself because of the wicked men, neither be envious for the evildoers.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they shall soon be cut down like grass, and shall wither as the green herb.
speaker: Narrator

text: Trust thou in the Lord and do good: dwell in the land, and thou shalt be fed assuredly:
speaker: Narrator

text: And delight thyself in the Lord, and he shall give thee thine heartâ€™s desire.
speaker: Narrator

text: Commit thy way unto the Lord, and trust in him, and he shall bring it to pass.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall bring forth thy righteousness as the light, and thy judgment as the noon day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wait patiently upon the Lord, and hope in him: fret not thyself for him which prospereth in his way, nor for the man that bringeth his enterprises to pass.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cease from anger, and leave off wrath: fret not thyself also to do evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: For evildoers shall be cut off, and they that wait upon the Lord, they shall inherit the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore yet a little while and the wicked shall not appear, and thou shalt look after his place, and he shall not be found.
speaker: Narrator

text: But meek men shall possess the earth, and shall have their delight in the multitude of peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked practiceth against the just, and gnasheth his teeth against him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord shall laugh him to scorn: for he seeth that his day is coming.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked have drawn their sword and have bent their bow, to cast down the poor and needy, and to slay such as be of upright conversation.
speaker: Narrator

text: But their sword shall enter into their own heart, and their bows shall be broken.
speaker: Narrator

text: A small thing unto the just man is better than great riches to the wicked and mighty.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the arms of the wicked shall be broken: but the Lord upholdeth the just men.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord knoweth the days of upright men, and their inheritance shall be perpetual.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall not be confounded in the perilous time, and in the days of famine they shall have enough.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the wicked shall perish, and the enemies of the Lord shall be consumed as the fat of lambs: even with the smoke shall they consume away.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked borroweth and payeth not again: but the righteous is merciful and giveth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For such as be blessed of God shall inherit the land, and they that be cursed of him, shall be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text: The paths of man are directed by the Lord: for he loveth his way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Though he fall, he shall not be cast off, for the Lord putteth under his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have been young, and am old: yet I saw never the righteous forsaken, nor his seed begging bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he is ever merciful and lendeth, and his seed enjoyeth the blessing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Flee from evil and do good, and dwell forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord loveth judgment, and forsaketh not his Saints: they shall be preserved forevermore: but the seed of the wicked shall be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous men shall inherit the land, and dwell therein forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mouth of the righteous will speak of wisdom, and his tongue will talk of judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Law of his God is in his heart, and his steps shall not slide.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked watched the righteous, and seeketh to slay him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord will not leave him in his hand, nor condemn him, when he is judged.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wait thou on the Lord, and keep his way, and he shall exalt thee, that thou shalt inherit the land: when the wicked men shall perish, thou shalt see.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have seen the wicked strong, and spreading himself like a green bay tree.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet he passed away, and lo, he was gone, and I sought him, but he could not be found.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mark the upright man, and behold the just: for the end of that man is peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: But their transgressors shall be destroyed together, and the end of the wicked shall be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the salvation of the righteous men shall be of the Lord: he shall be their strength in the time of trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord shall help them, and deliver them: he shall deliver them from the wicked, and shall save them, because they trust in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, rebuke me not in thine anger, neither chastise me in thy wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thine arrows have light upon me, and thine hand lieth upon me.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is nothing sound in my flesh, because of thine anger: neither is there rest in my bones, because of my sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: For mine iniquities are gone over mine head, and as a weighty burden they are too heavy for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: My wounds are putrefied, and corrupt because of my foolishness.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am bowed, and crooked very sore: I go mourning all the day.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my reins are full of burning, and there is nothing sound in my flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am weakened and sore broken: I roar for the very grief of mine heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, I pour my whole desire before thee, and my sighing is not hid from thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine heart panteth: my strength faileth me, and the light of mine eyes, even they are not mine own.
speaker: Narrator

text: My lovers and my friends stand aside from my plague, and my kinsmen stand afar off.
speaker: Narrator

text: They also that seek after my life, lay snares, and they that go about to do me evil, talk wicked things and imagine deceit continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I as a deaf man heard not, and am as a dumb man, which openeth not his mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus am I as a man, that heareth not, and in whose mouth are no reproofs.
speaker: Narrator

text: For on thee, O Lord, do I wait: thou wilt hear me, my Lord, my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I said, Hear me, lest they rejoice over me: for when my foot slippeth, they extol themselves against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely I am ready to halt, and my sorrow is ever before me.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I declare my pain, and am sorry for my sin,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then mine enemies are alive, and are mighty, and they that hate me wrongfully are many.
speaker: Narrator

text: They also, that reward evil for good, are mine adversaries, because I follow goodness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Forsake me not, O Lord, be not thou far from me, my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Haste thee, to help me, O my Lord, my salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: I thought, I will take heed to my ways, that I sin not with my tongue: I will keep my mouth bridled, while the wicked is in my sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was dumb and spake nothing: I kept silence even from good, and my sorrow was more stirred.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine heart was hot within me, and while I was musing, the fire kindled, and I spake with my tongue, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, let me know mine end, and the measure of my days, what it is: let me know how long I have to live.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, thou hast made my days as an hand breadth, and mine age as nothing in respect of thee: surely every man in his best state is altogether vanity. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Doubtless man walketh in a shadow, and disquieteth himself in vain: he heapeth up riches, and cannot tell who shall gather them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now Lord, what wait I for? mine hope is even in thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver me from all my transgressions, and make me not a rebuke unto the foolish.
speaker: Narrator

text: I should have been dumb, and not have opened my mouth, because thou didst it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take thy plague away from me: for I am consumed by the stroke of thine hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou with rebukes dost chastise man for iniquity, thou as a moth makest his beauty to consume: surely every man is vanity. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear my prayer, O Lord, and hearken unto my cry: keep not silence at my tears, for I am a stranger with thee, and a sojourner as all my fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Stay thine anger from me, that I may recover my strength, before I go hence and be not.
speaker: Narrator

text: I waited patiently for the Lord, and he inclined unto me, and heard my cry.
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought me also out of the horrible pit, out of the miry clay, and set my feet upon the rock, and ordered my goings.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he hath put in my mouth a new song of praise unto our God: many shall see it and fear, and shall trust in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is the man that maketh the Lord his trust, and regardeth not the proud, nor such as turn aside to lies.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord my God, thou hast made thy wonderful works so many, that none can count in order to thee thy thoughts toward us: I would declare and speak of them, but they are more than I am able to express.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sacrifice and offering thou didst not desire: (for mine ears hast thou prepared) burnt offering and sin offering hast thou not required.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said I, Lo, I come: for in the roll of the book it is written of me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I desired to do thy good will, O my God: yea, thy Law is within mine heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have declared thy righteousness in the great congregation: lo, I will not refrain my lips: O Lord, thou knowest.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have not hid thy righteousness within mine heart, but I have declared thy truth and thy salvation: I have not concealed thy mercy, and thy truth from the great Congregation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Withdraw not thou thy tender mercy from me, O Lord, let thy mercy and thy truth always preserve me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For innumerable troubles have compassed me: my sins have taken such hold upon me, that I am not able to look up: yea, they are more in number than the hairs of mine head: therefore mine heart hath failed me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let it please thee, O Lord, to deliver me: make haste, O Lord, to help me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be confounded and put to shame together, that seek my soul to destroy it: let them be driven backward and put to rebuke that desire mine hurt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be destroyed for a reward of their shame, which say unto me, Aha, aha.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let all them that seek thee, rejoice and be glad in thee, and let them that love thy salvation, say always, The Lord be praised.
speaker: Narrator

text: Though I be poor and needy, the Lord thinketh on me: thou art mine helper and my deliverer: my God, make no tarrying.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is he that judgeth wisely of the poor: the Lord shall deliver him in the time of trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will keep him and preserve him alive, he shall be blessed upon the earth: and thou wilt not deliver him unto the will of his enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will strengthen him upon the bed of sorrow: thou hast turned all his bed in his sickness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I said, Lord have mercy upon me: heal my soul, for I have sinned against thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine enemies speak evil of me, saying, When shall he die, and his name perish?
speaker: Narrator

text: And if he come to see me, he speaketh lies, but his heart heapeth iniquity within him, and when he cometh forth, he telleth it.
speaker: Narrator

text: All they that hate me whisper together against me: even against me do they imagine mine hurt.
speaker: Narrator

text: A mischief is light upon him, and he that lieth, shall no more rise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, my familiar friend, whom I trusted, which did eat of my bread, hath lifted up the heel against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, O Lord, have mercy upon me, and raise me up: so shall I reward them.
speaker: Narrator

text: By this I know that thou favorest me, because mine enemy doth not triumph against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as for me thou upholdest me in mine integrity, and dost set me before thy face forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel world without end. So be it, even so be it.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the Hart brayeth for the rivers of water, so panted my soul after thee, O God.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul thirsteth for God, even for the living God: when shall I come and appear before the presence of God?
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine tears have been my meat day and night, while they daily say unto me, Where is thy God?
speaker: Narrator

text: When I remembered these things, I poured out my very heart, because I had gone with the multitude, and led them into the house of God with the voice of singing, and praise, as a multitude that keepeth a feast.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why art thou cast down, my soul, and unquiet within me? wait on God: for I will yet give him thanks for the help of his presence.
speaker: Narrator

text: My God, my soul is cast down within me, because I remembered thee, from the land of Jordan, and Hermon, and from the mount Mizar.
speaker: Narrator

text: One deep calleth another deep by the noise of thy waterspouts: all thy waves and thy floods are gone over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will grant his loving-kindness in the day, and in the night shall I sing of him, even a prayer unto the God of my life.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will say unto God, which is my rock, Why hast thou forgotten me? why go I mourning, when the enemy oppresseth me?
speaker: Narrator

text: My bones are cut asunder, while mine enemies reproach me, saying daily unto me, Where is thy God?
speaker: Narrator

text: Why art thou cast down, my soul? and why art thou disquieted within me? wait on God: for I will yet give him thanks: he is my present help and my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Judge me, O God, and defend my cause against the unmerciful people: deliver me from the deceitful and wicked man.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou art the God of my strength: why hast thou put me away? why go I so mourning, when the enemy oppressed me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Send thy light and thy truth: let them lead me: let them bring me unto thine holy Mountain, and to thy Tabernacles.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then will I go unto the altar of God, even unto the God of my joy and gladness: and upon the harp will I give thanks unto thee, O God my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why art thou cast down, my soul? and why art thou disquieted within me: wait on God: for I will yet give him thanks, he is my present help and my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have heard with our ears, O God: our fathers have told us the works that thou hast done in their days, in the old time:
speaker: Narrator

text: How thou hast driven out the heathen with thine hand, and planted them: how thou hast destroyed the people, and caused them to grow.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they inherited not the land by their own sword, neither did their own arm save them: but thy right hand, and thine arm, and the light of thy countenance, because thou didst favor them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou art my king, O God: send help unto Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Through thee have we thrust back our adversaries: by thy Name have we trodden down them that rose up against us.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I do not trust in my bow, neither can my sword save me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou hast saved us from our adversaries, and hast put them to confusion that hate us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore will we praise God continually, and will confess thy Name forever. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now thou art far off, and puttest us to confusion, and goest not forth with our armies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou makest us to turn back from the adversary, and they which hate us, spoil for themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou givest us as sheep to be eaten, and dost scatter us among the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou sellest thy people without gain, and dost not increase their price.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou makest us a reproach to our neighbors, a jest and laughing stock to them that are round about us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou makest us a proverb among the nations, and a nodding of the head among the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: My confusion is daily before me, and the shame of my face hath covered me,
speaker: Narrator

text: For the voice of the slanderer and rebuker, for the enemy and avenger.
speaker: Narrator

text: All this is come upon us, yet do we not forget thee, neither deal we falsely concerning thy covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our heart is not turned back: neither our steps gone out of thy paths,
speaker: Narrator

text: Albeit thou hast smitten us down into the place of dragons, and covered us with the shadow of death.
speaker: Narrator

text: If we have forgotten the Name of our God, and held up our hands to a strange god,
speaker: Narrator

text: Shall not God search this out? for he knoweth the secrets of the heart.
speaker: Narrator
