text: Surely for thy sake are we slain continually, and are counted as sheep for the slaughter.
speaker: Narrator

text: Up, why sleepest thou, O Lord? awake, be not far off forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore hidest thou thy face? and forgettest our misery and our affliction?
speaker: Narrator

text: For our soul is beaten down unto the dust: our belly cleaveth to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rise up for our succor, and redeem us for thy mercyâ€™s sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine heart will utter forth a good matter: I will entreat in my works of the king: my tongue is as the pen of a swift writer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou art fairer than the children of men: grace is poured in thy lips, because God hath blessed thee forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gird thy sword upon thy thigh, O most mighty, to wit, thy worship and thy glory:
speaker: Narrator

text: And prosper with thy glory: ride upon the word of truth and of meekness and of righteousness: so thy right hand shall teach thee terrible things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thine arrows are sharp to pierce the heart of the Kingâ€™s enemies: therefore the people shall fall under thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy throne, O God, is forever and ever: the scepter of thy kingdom, is a scepter of righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou lovest righteousness, and hatest wickedness, because God, even thy God, hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.
speaker: Narrator

text: All thy garments smell of myrrh and aloes, and cassia, when thou comest out of the ivory palaces where they have made thee glad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Kingâ€™s daughters were among thine honorable wives: upon thy right hand did stand the Queen in a vesture of gold of Ophir.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hearken, O daughter, and consider, and incline thine ear: forget also thine own people and thy fatherâ€™s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: So shall the King have pleasure in thy beauty: for he is thy Lord, and reverence thou him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the daughter of Tyre with the rich of the people, shall do homage before thy face with presents.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Kingâ€™s daughter is all glorious within: her clothing is of broidered gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: She shall be brought unto the King in raiment of needlework: the virgins that follow after her, and her companions shall be brought unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: With joy and gladness shall they be brought, and shall enter into the kingâ€™s palace.
speaker: Narrator

text: Instead of thy fathers shall thy children be: thou shalt make them princes through all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will make thy Name to be remembered through all generations: therefore shall the people give thanks unto thee, world without end.
speaker: Narrator

text: God is our hope and strength, and help in troubles, ready to be found.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore will not we fear, though the earth be moved, and though the mountains fall into the midst of the sea,
speaker: Narrator

text: Though the waters thereof rage and be troubled, and the mountains shake at the surges of the same. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet there is a River, whose stream shall make glad the City of God: even the Sanctuary of the Tabernacles of the most High.
speaker: Narrator

text: God is in the midst of it: therefore shall it not be moved: God shall help it very early.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the nations raged, and the kingdoms were moved, God thundered, and the earth melted.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come and behold the works of the Lord, what desolations he hath made in the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He maketh wars to cease unto the ends of the world, he breaketh the bow, and cutteth the spear, and burneth the chariots with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be still and know that I am God, I will be exalted among the heathen, and I will be exalted in the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: All people clap your hands; sing loud unto God with a joyful voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord is high, and terrible; a great King over all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath subdued the people under us, and the nations under our feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath chosen our inheritance for us: even the glory of Jacob whom he loved. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: God is gone up with triumph, even the Lord with the sound of the trumpet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing praises to God, sing praises: sing praises unto our King, sing praises.
speaker: Narrator

text: For God is the king of all the earth: sing praises everyone that hath understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: God reigneth over the heathen: God sitteth upon his holy Throne.
speaker: Narrator

text: The princes of the people are gathered unto the people of the God of Abraham: for the shields of the world belong to God: he is greatly to be exalted.
speaker: Narrator

text: Great is the Lord, and greatly to be praised in the City of our God, even upon his holy Mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mount Zion, lying Northward, is fair in situation: it is the joy of the whole earth, and the City of the great king.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the palaces thereof God is known for a refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text: For lo, the kings were gathered, and went together.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they saw it, they marveled: they were astonied, and suddenly driven back.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fear came there upon them, and sorrow, as upon a woman in travail.
speaker: Narrator

text: As with an East wind thou breakest the ships of Tarshish, so were they destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: As we have heard, so have we seen in the City of the Lord of hosts, in the city of our God: God will establish it forever. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: We wait for thy loving-kindness, O God, in the midst of thy Temple.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, according to thy Name, so is thy praise unto the worldâ€™s end: thy right hand is full of righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let mount Zion rejoice, and the daughters of Judah be glad, because of thy judgments.
speaker: Narrator

text: Compass about Zion, and go round about it, and tell the towers thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mark well the wall thereof: behold her towers, that ye may tell your posterity.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this God is our God forever and ever, he shall be our guide unto the death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear this all ye people: give ear, all ye that dwell in the world,
speaker: Narrator

text: As well low as high, both rich and poor.
speaker: Narrator

text: My mouth shall speak of wisdom, and the meditation of mine heart is of knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will incline mine ear to a parable, and utter my grave matter upon the harp.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore should I fear in the evil days, when iniquity shall compass me about, as at mine heels?
speaker: Narrator

text: They trust in their goods, and boast themselves in the multitude of their riches.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet a man can by no means redeem his brother: he cannot give his ransom to God,
speaker: Narrator

text: (So precious is the redemption of their souls, and the continuance forever)
speaker: Narrator

text: That he may live still forever, and not see the grave.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he seeth that wise men die: and also that the ignorant and foolish perish, and leave their riches for others.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet they think their houses and their habitations shall continue forever, even from generation to generation, and call their lands by their names.
speaker: Narrator

text: But man shall not continue in honor; he is like the beasts that die.
speaker: Narrator

text: This their way uttereth their foolishness; yet their posterity delight in their talk. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Like sheep they lie in grave; death devoureth them; and the righteous shall have domination over them in the morning; for their beauty shall consume, when they shall go from their house to grave.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God shall deliver my soul from the power of the grave; for he will receive me. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be not thou afraid when one is made rich, and when the glory of his house is increased.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he shall take nothing away, when he dieth, neither shall his pomp descend after him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For while he lived, he rejoiced himself; and men will praise thee, when thou makest much of thyself.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall enter into the generation of his fathers, and they shall not live forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Man is in honor; and understandeth not; he is like to beasts that perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: The God of gods, even the Lord hath spoken and called the earth from the rising up of the Sun, unto the going down thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of Zion, which is the perfection of beauty, hath God shined.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our God shall come, and shall not keep silence: a fire shall devour before him, and a mighty tempest shall be moved round about him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall call the heaven above, and the earth to judge his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gather my Saints together unto me, those that make a covenant with me with sacrifice.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God is Judge himself. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, O my people and I will speak: hear, O Israel, and I will testify unto thee: for I am God, even thy God.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will not reprove thee for thy sacrifices, or thy burnt offerings, that have not been continually before me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will take no bullock out of thine house, nor goats out of thy folds.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all the beasts of the forest are mine, and the beasts on a thousand mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text: I know all the fowls on the mountains, and the wild beasts of the field are mine.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I be hungry, I will not tell thee: for the world is mine and all that therein is.
speaker: Narrator

text: Will I eat the flesh of bulls? or drink the blood of goats?
speaker: Narrator

text: Offer unto God praise, and pay thy vows unto the most High,
speaker: Narrator

text: And call upon me in the day of trouble: so will I deliver thee, and thou shalt glorify me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But unto the wicked said God, What hast thou to do to declare mine ordinances, that thou shouldest take my covenant in thy mouth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Seeing thou hatest to be reformed, and hast cast my words behind thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: For when thou seest a thief, thou runnest with him, and thou art partaker with the adulterers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou givest thy mouth to evil, and with thy tongue thou forgest deceit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou sittest, and speakest against thy brother, and slanderest thy motherâ€™s son.
speaker: Narrator

text: These things hast thou done, and I held my tongue: therefore thou thoughtest that I was like thee: but I will reprove thee, and set them in order before thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Oh consider this ye that forget God, lest I tear you in pieces, and there be none that can deliver you.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that offereth praise, shall glorify me: and to him that disposeth his way aright, will I show the salvation of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have mercy upon me, O God, according to thy loving-kindness: according to the multitude of thy compassions put away mine iniquities.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wash me thoroughly from mine iniquity, and cleanse me from mine sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I know mine iniquities, and my sin is ever before me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Against thee, against thee only have I sinned, and done evil in thy sight, that thou mayest be just when thou speakest, and pure when thou judgest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I was born in iniquity, and in sin hath my mother conceived me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, thou lovest truth in the inward affections: therefore hast thou taught me wisdom in the secret of mine heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean: wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make me to hear joy and gladness, that the bones, which thou hast broken, may rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hide thy face from my sins, and put away all mine iniquities.
speaker: Narrator

text: Create in me a clean heart, O God, and renew a right spirit within me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cast me not away from thy presence, and take not thine holy Spirit from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Restore to me the joy of thy salvation, and establish me with thy free Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shall I teach thy ways unto the wicked, and sinners shall be converted unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver me from blood, O God, which art the God of my salvation, and my tongue shall sing joyfully of thy righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Open thou my lips, O Lord, and my mouth shall show forth thy praise.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou desirest no sacrifice, though I would give it: thou delightest not in burnt offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sacrifices of God are a contrite spirit: a contrite and a broken heart, O God, thou wilt not despise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be favorable unto Zion for thy good pleasure: build the walls of Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shalt thou accept the sacrifices of righteousness, even the burnt offering and oblation: then shall they offer calves upon thine altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why boastest thou thyself in thy wickedness, O man of power? the loving-kindness of God endureth daily.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy tongue imagineth mischief, and is like a sharp razor, that cutteth deceitfully.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou dost love evil more than good, and lies more than to speak the truth. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou lovest all words that may destroy: O deceitful tongue!
speaker: Narrator

text: So shall God destroy thee forever: he shall take thee and pluck thee out of thy tabernacle, and root thee out of the land of the living. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous also shall see it, and fear, and shall laugh at him, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold the man that took not God for his strength, but trusteth unto the multitude of his riches, and put his strength in his malice.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I shall be like a green olive tree in the house of God: for I trusted in the mercy of God forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will always praise thee, for that thou hast done this, and I will hope in thy name, because it is good before thy Saints.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fool hath said in his heart, There is no God, they have corrupted and done abominable wickedness, there is none that doeth good.
speaker: Narrator

text: God looked down from heaven upon the children of men, to see if there were any that would understand and seek God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everyone is gone back: they are altogether corrupt: there is none that doeth good, no not one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not the workers of iniquity know that they eat up my people as they eat bread? they call not upon God.
speaker: Narrator

text: There they were afraid for fear, where no fear was: for God hath scattered the bones of him that besieged thee: thou hast put them to confusion, because God hath cast them off.
speaker: Narrator

text: Oh give salvation unto Israel out of Zion: when God turneth the captivity of his people, then Jacob shall rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Save me, O God, by thy Name, and by thy power judge me.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, hear my prayer: hearken unto the words of my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For strangers are risen up against me, and tyrants seek my soul: they have not set God before them. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, God is mine helper: the Lord is with them that uphold my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall reward evil unto mine enemies: Oh cut them off in thy truth!
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I will sacrifice freely unto thee: I will praise thy Name, O Lord, because it is good.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he hath delivered me out of all trouble, and mine eye hath seen my desire upon mine enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear my prayer, O God, and hide not thyself from my supplication.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hearken unto me, and answer me: I mourn in my prayer, and make a noise,
speaker: Narrator

text: For the voice of the enemy, and for the vexation of the wicked, because they have brought iniquity upon me, and furiously hate me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine heart trembleth within me, and the terrors of death are fallen upon me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fear and trembling are come upon me, and an horrible fear hath covered me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I said, Oh that I had wings like a dove: then would I fly away and rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold I would take my flight far off, and lodge in the wilderness. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: He would make haste for my deliverance from the stormy wind and tempest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Destroy, O Lord, and divide their tongues: for I have seen cruelty and strife in the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: Day and night they go about it upon the walls thereof, both iniquity and mischief are in the midst of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wickedness is in the midst thereof: deceit and guile depart not from her streets.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely mine enemy did not defame me, for I could have borne it: neither did mine adversary exalt himself against me: for I would have hid me from him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But it was thou, O man, even my companion, my guide, and my familiar:
speaker: Narrator

text: Which delighted in consulting together, and went into the house of God as companions.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let death seize upon them: let them go down quick into the grave: for wickedness is in their dwellings even in the midst of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will call unto God, and the Lord will save me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Evening and morning, and at noon will I pray and make a noise, and he will hear my voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath delivered my soul in peace from the battle that was against me: for many were with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: God shall hear and afflict them, even he that reigneth of old, Selah: because they have no changes, therefore they fear not God.
speaker: Narrator

text: He laid his hand upon such as be at peace with him, and he brake his covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: The words of his mouth were softer than butter, yet war was in his heart, his words were more gentle than oil, yet they were swords.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cast thy burden upon the Lord, and he shall nourish thee: he will not suffer the righteous to fall forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou, O God, shalt bring them down into the pit of corruption: the bloody, and deceitful men shall not live half their days: but I will trust in thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be merciful unto me, O God, for man would swallow me up: he fighteth continually and vexeth me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine enemies would daily swallow me up: for many fight against me, O thou most High.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I was afraid, I trusted in thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will rejoice in God, because of his word, I trust in God, and will not fear what flesh can do unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine own words grieve me daily: all their thoughts are against me to do me hurt.
speaker: Narrator

text: They gather together, and keep themselves close: they mark my steps, because they wait for my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: They think they shall escape by iniquity: O God, cast these people down in thine anger.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast counted my wanderings; put my tears into thy bottle; are they not in thy register?
speaker: Narrator

text: When I cry, then mine enemies shall turn back; this I know, for God is with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will rejoice in God because of his word; in the Lord will I rejoice because of his word.
speaker: Narrator

text: In God do I trust; I will not be afraid what man can do unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy vows are upon me, O God, I will render praises unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou hast delivered my soul from death, and also my feet from falling, that I may walk before God in the light of the living.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have mercy upon me, O God, have mercy upon me; for my soul trusteth in thee, and in the shadow of thy wings will I trust, till these afflictions overpass.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will call unto the most high God, even the God, that performeth his promise toward me.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will send from heaven, and save me from the reproof of him that would swallow me. Selah. God will send his mercy, and his truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul is among lions; I lie among the children of men, that are set on fire; whose teeth are spears and arrows, and their tongue a sharp sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: Exalt thyself, O God, above the heaven, and let thy glory be upon all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have laid a net for my steps; my soul is pressed down, they have dug a pit before me, and are fallen into the midst of it. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine heart is prepared, O God, mine heart is prepared; I will sing and give praise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Awake my tongue, awake viol and harp: I will awake early.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will praise thee, O Lord, among the people, and I will sing unto thee among the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thy mercy is great unto the heavens, and thy truth unto the clouds.
speaker: Narrator

text: Exalt thyself, O God, above the heavens, and let thy glory be upon all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Is it true? O congregation, speak ye justly? O sons of men judge ye uprightly?
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, rather ye imagine mischief in your heart: your hands execute cruelty upon the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked are strangers from the womb: even from the belly have they erred, and speak lies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their poison is even like the poison of a serpent; like the deaf adder that stoppeth his ear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Which heareth not the voice of the enchanter, though he be most expert in charming.
speaker: Narrator

text: Break their teeth, O God, in their mouths: break the jaws of the young lions, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them melt like the waters, let them pass away; when he shooteth his arrows, let them be as broken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them consume like a snail that melteth, and like the untimely fruit of a woman, that hath not seen the sun.
speaker: Narrator

text: As raw flesh before your pots feel the fire of thorns: so let them carry them away as with a whirlwind in his wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous shall rejoice when he seeth the vengeance; he shall wash his feet in the blood of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: And men shall say, Verily there is fruit for the righteous; doubtless there is a God that judgeth in the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: O my God, deliver me from mine enemies; defend me from them that rise up against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver me from the wicked doers, and save me from the bloody men.
speaker: Narrator

text: For lo, they have laid wait for my soul; the mighty men are gathered against me, not for mine offense, nor for my sin, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: They run and prepare themselves without a fault on my part: arise therefore to assist me, and behold.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even thou, O Lord God of hosts, O God of Israel, awake to visit all the heathen, and be not merciful unto all that transgress maliciously. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They go to and fro in the evening: they bark like dogs, and go about the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, they brag in their talk, and swords are in their lips: for who, say they, doth hear?
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou, O Lord, shalt have them in derision, and thou shalt laugh at all the heathen.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is strong: but I will wait upon thee: for God is my defense.
speaker: Narrator

text: My merciful God will prevent me: God will let me see my desire upon mine enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Slay them not, lest my people forget it: but scatter them abroad by thy power, and put them down, O Lord, our shield,
speaker: Narrator

text: For the sin of their mouth, and the words of their lips: and let them be taken in their pride, even for their perjury and lies, that they speak.
speaker: Narrator

text: Consume them in thy wrath: consume them that they be no more: and let them know that God ruleth in Jacob, even unto the ends of the world. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the evening they shall go to and fro, and bark like dogs, and go about the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall run here and there for meat, and surely they shall not be satisfied, though they tarry all night.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will sing of thy power, and will praise thy mercy in the morning: for thou hast been my defense and refuge in the day of my trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto thee, O my Strength will I sing: for God is my defense, and my merciful God.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, thou hast cast us out, thou hast scattered us, thou hast been angry, turn again unto us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast made the land to tremble, and hast made it to gape: heal the breaches thereof, for it is shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast showed thy people heavy things: thou hast made us to drink the wine of giddiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now thou hast given a banner to them that fear thee, that it may be displayed because of thy truth. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: That thy beloved may be delivered, help with thy right hand and hear me.
speaker: Narrator

text: God hath spoken in his holiness: therefore I will rejoice: I shall divide Shechem, and measure the valley of Succoth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gilead shall be mine, and Manasseh shall be mine: Ephraim also shall be the strength of mine head: Judah is my lawgiver.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moab shall be my washpot: over Edom will I cast out my shoe: Philistia show thyself joyful for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who will lead me into the strong city? who will bring me unto Edom?
speaker: Narrator

text: Wilt not thou, O God, which hadst cast us off, and didst not go forth, O God, with our armies?
speaker: Narrator

text: Give us help against trouble: for vain is the help of man.
speaker: Narrator

text: Through God we shall do valiantly; for he shall tread down our enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear my cry, O God: give ear unto my prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the ends of the earth will I cry unto thee: when mine heart is oppressed, bring me upon the rock that is higher than I.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou hast been my hope, and a strong tower against the enemy.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will dwell in thy Tabernacle forever, and my trust shall be under the covering of thy wings. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou, O God, hast heard my desires; thou hast given an heritage unto those that fear thy Name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt give the King a long life; his years shall be as many ages.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall dwell before God forever; prepare mercy and faithfulness, that they may preserve him.
speaker: Narrator

text: So will I always sing praise unto thy Name, in performing daily my vows.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet my soul keepeth silence unto God; of him cometh my salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet he is my strength and my salvation, and my defense; therefore I shall not much be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: How long will ye imagine mischief against a man? ye shall be all slain; ye shall be as a bowed wall, or as a wall shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet they consult to cast him down from his dignity; their delight is in lies: they bless with their mouths, but curse with their hearts. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet my soul, keep thou silence unto God: for mine hope is in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet is he my strength and my salvation, and my defense: therefore I shall not be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: In God is my salvation and my glory, the rock of my strength; in God is my trust.
speaker: Narrator

text: Trust in him always, ye people; pour out your hearts before him, for God is our hope. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet the children of men are vanity, the chief men are liars: to lay them upon a balance they are altogether lighter than vanity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Trust not in oppression nor in robbery: be not vain: if riches increase, set not your heart thereon.
speaker: Narrator

text: God spake once or twice, I have heard it, that power belongeth unto God,
speaker: Narrator

text: And to thee, O Lord, mercy: for thou rewardest everyone according to his work.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, thou art my God, early will I seek thee: my soul thirsteth for thee: my flesh longeth greatly after thee in a barren and dry land without water:
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus I behold thee as in the Sanctuary, when I behold thy power and thy glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thy loving-kindness is better than life: therefore my lips shall praise thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus will I magnify thee all my life, and lift up mine hands in thy Name.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul shall be satisfied, as with marrow and fatness, and my mouth shall praise thee with joyful lips,
speaker: Narrator

text: When I remember thee on my bed, and when I think upon thee in the night watches.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because thou hast been mine helper, therefore under the shadow of thy wings will I rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul cleaveth unto thee: for thy right hand upholdeth me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore they that seek my soul to destroy it, they shall go into the lowest parts of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall cast him down with the edge of the sword, and they shall be a portion for foxes.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the king shall rejoice in God, and all that swear by him shall rejoice in him: for the mouth of them that speak lies, shall be stopped.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear my voice, O God, in my prayer: preserve my life from fear of the enemy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hide me from the conspiracy of the wicked, and from the rage of the works of iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Which have whet their tongue like a sword, and shot for their arrows bitter words:
speaker: Narrator

text: To shoot at the upright in secret: they shoot at him suddenly and fear not.
speaker: Narrator

text: They encourage themselves in a wicked purpose: they commune together to lay snares privily, and say, Who shall see them?
speaker: Narrator

text: They have sought out iniquities, and have accomplished that which they sought out, even everyone his secret thoughts, and the depth of his heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God will shoot an arrow at them suddenly: their strokes shall be at once.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall cause their own tongue to fall upon them: and whosoever shall see them, shall flee away.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all men shall see it, and declare the work of God, and they shall understand, what he hath wrought.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the righteous shall be glad in the Lord, and trust in him: and all that are upright of heart, shall rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, praise waiteth for thee in Zion, and unto thee shall the vow be performed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because thou hearest the prayer, unto thee shall all flesh come.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wicked deeds have prevailed against me: but thou wilt be merciful unto our transgressions.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is he, whom thou choosest and causest to come to thee: he shall dwell in thy courts, and we shall be satisfied with the pleasures of thine House, even of thine holy Temple.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God of our salvation, thou wilt answer us with fearful signs in thy righteousness, O thou the hope of all the ends of the earth, and of them that are far off in the Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: He establisheth the mountains by his power: and is girded about with strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: He appeaseth the noise of the seas, and the noise of the waves thereof, and the tumults of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: They also that dwell in the uttermost parts of the earth, shall be afraid of thy signs; thou shalt make the East and the West to rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou visitest the earth, and waterest it; thou makest it very rich: the river of God is full of water, thou preparest them corn; for so thou appointest it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou waterest abundantly the furrows thereof; thou causest the rain to descend into the valleys thereof; thou makest it soft with showers, and blessest the bud thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou crownest the year with thy goodness, and thy steps drop fatness.
speaker: Narrator

text: They drop upon the pastures of the wilderness: and the hills shall be compassed with gladness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The pastures are clad with sheep; the valleys also shall be covered with corn; therefore they shout for joy, and sing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoice in God, all ye inhabitants of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing forth the glory of his Name: make his praise glorious.
speaker: Narrator

text: Say unto God, How terrible art thou in thy works! through the greatness of thy power shall thine enemies be in subjection unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the world shall worship thee, and sing unto thee, even sing of thy Name. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come and behold the works of God: he is terrible in his doings toward the sons of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath turned the sea into dry land: they passed through the river on foot: there did we rejoice in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He ruleth the world with his power: his eyes behold the nations: the rebellious shall not exalt themselves. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise our God, ye people, and make the voice of his praise to be heard.
speaker: Narrator

text: Which holdeth our souls in life, and suffereth not our feet to slip.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou, O God, hast proved us, thou hast tried us as silver is tried.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast brought us unto the snare, and laid a strait chain upon our loins.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast caused men to ride over our heads: we went into fire and into water, but thou broughtest us out into a wealthy place.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will go into thine House with burnt offerings, and will pay thee my vows,
speaker: Narrator

text: Which my lips have promised, and my mouth hath spoken in mine affliction.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will offer unto thee the burnt offerings of fat rams with incense: I will prepare bullocks and goats. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come and hearken, all ye that fear God, and I will tell you what he hath done to my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: I called unto him with my mouth, and he was exalted with my tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I regard wickedness in mine heart, the Lord will not hear me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God hath heard me, and considered the voice of my prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praised be God, which hath not put back my prayer, nor his mercy from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: God be merciful unto us, and bless us, and cause his face to shine among us. (Selah.)
speaker: Narrator

text: That they may know thy way upon earth, and thy saving health among all nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the people praise thee, O God: let all the people praise thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the people be glad and rejoice: for thou shalt judge the people righteously, and govern the nations upon the earth. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the people praise thee, O God: let all the people praise thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shall the earth bring forth her increase, and God, even our God shall bless us.
speaker: Narrator

text: God shall bless us, and all the ends of the earth shall fear him.
speaker: Narrator

text: God will arise, and his enemies shall be scattered: they also that hate him, shall flee before him.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the smoke vanisheth, so shalt thou drive them away: and as wax melteth before the fire, so shall the wicked perish at the presence of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the righteous shall be glad, and rejoice before God: yea, they shall leap for joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing unto God, and sing praises unto his name: exalt him that rideth upon the heavens, in his Name Jah, and rejoice before him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is a Father of the fatherless, and a Judge of the widows, even God in his holy habitation.
speaker: Narrator

text: God maketh the solitary to dwell in families, and delivereth them that were prisoners in stocks: but the rebellious shall dwell in a dry land.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, when thou wentest forth before thy people: when thou wentest through the wilderness, (Selah.)
speaker: Narrator

text: The earth shook, and the heavens dropped at the presence of this God: even Sinai was moved at the presence of God, even the God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou, O God, sentest a gracious rain upon thine inheritance, and thou didst refresh it when it was weary.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy Congregation dwelled therein: for thou, O God, hast of thy goodness prepared it for the poor.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord gave matter to the women to tell of the great army.
speaker: Narrator

text: Kings of the armies did flee: they did flee, and she that remained in the house, divided the spoil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Though ye have lain among pots, yet shall ye be as the wings of a dove that is covered with silver, and whose feathers are like yellow gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Almighty scattered kings in it, it was white as the snow in Zalmon.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mountain of God is like the mountain of Bashan: it is an high mountain, as mount Bashan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why leap ye, ye high mountains? as for this Mountain, God delighteth to dwell in it: yea, the Lord will dwell in it forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: The chariots of God are twenty thousand thousand Angels, and the Lord is among them, as in the Sanctuary of Sinai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou art gone up on high: thou hast led captivity captive, and received gifts for men: yea, even the rebellious hast thou led, that the Lord God might dwell there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praised be the Lord, even the God of our salvation, which ladeth us daily with benefits. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is our God, even the God that saveth us: and to the Lord God belong the issues of death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely God will wound the head of his enemies, and the hairy pate of him that walketh in his sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord hath said, I will bring my people again from Bashan: I will bring them again from the depths of the Sea:
speaker: Narrator

text: That thy foot may be dipped in blood, and the tongue of thy dogs in the blood of the enemies, even in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have seen, O God, thy goings, the goings of my God, and my king, which art in the Sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: The singers went before, the players of instruments after: in the midst were the maids playing with timbrels.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye God in the assemblies, and the Lord, ye that are of the fountain of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was little Benjamin with their ruler, and the Princes of Judah with their assembly, the princes of Zebulun, and the princes of Naphtali.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy GOD hath appointed thy strength: establish, O God, that which thou first wrought in us,
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of thy Temple upon Jerusalem, and kings shall bring presents unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Destroy the company of the spearmen, and multitude of the mighty bulls with the calves of the people, that tread under feet pieces of silver: scatter the people that delight in war.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shall the princes come out of Egypt: Ethiopia shall haste to stretch her hands unto God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing unto God, O ye kingdoms of the earth: sing praise unto the Lord, (Selah)
speaker: Narrator

text: To him that rideth upon the most high heavens, which were from the beginning: behold, he will send out by his voice a mighty sound.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ascribe the power to God: for his majesty is upon Israel, and his strength is in the clouds.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, thou art terrible out of thine holy places: the God of Israel is he that giveth strength and power unto the people: praised be God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Save me, O God: for the waters are entered even to my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: I stick fast in the deep mire, where no stay is: I am come into deep waters, and the streams run over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am weary of crying: my throat is dry: mine eyes fail, while I wait for my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: They that hate me without a cause, are more than the hairs of mine head: they that would destroy me, and are mine enemies falsely, are mighty, so that I restored that which I took not.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, thou knowest my foolishness, and my faults are not hid from thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let not them that trust in thee, O Lord God of hosts, be ashamed for me: let not those that seek thee, be confounded through me, O God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thy sake have I suffered reproof: shame hath covered my face.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am become a stranger unto my brethren, even an alien unto my motherâ€™s sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the zeal of thine house hath eaten me, and the rebukes of them that rebuked thee, are fallen upon me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I wept and my soul fasted, but that was to my reproof.
speaker: Narrator

text: I put on a sack also: and I became a proverb unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They that sat in the gate, spake of me, and the drunkards sang of me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Lord, I make my prayer unto thee in an acceptable time, even in the multitude of thy mercy: O God, hear me in the truth of thy salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver me out of the mire, that I sink not: let me be delivered from them that hate me, and out of the deep waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let not the water flood drown me, neither let the deep swallow me up: and let not the pit shut her mouth upon me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear me, O Lord, for thy loving-kindness is good: turn unto me according to the multitude of thy tender mercies.
speaker: Narrator

text: And hide not thy face from thy servant, for I am in trouble; make haste and hear me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Draw near unto my soul and redeem it: deliver me because of mine enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast known my reproof and my shame, and my dishonor: all mine adversaries are before thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rebuke hath broken mine heart, and I am full of heaviness, and I looked for some to have pity on me, but there was none: and for comforters, but I found none.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they gave me gall in my meat, and in my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let their table be a snare before them, and their prosperity their ruin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let their eyes be blinded that they see not: and make their loins always to tremble.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pour out thine anger upon them, and let thy wrathful displeasure take them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let their habitation be void, and let none dwell in their tents.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they persecute him, whom thou hast smitten: and they add unto the sorrow of them, whom thou hast wounded.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lay iniquity upon their iniquity, and let them not come into thy righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be put out of the book of life, neither let them be written with the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I am poor and in heaviness, thine help, O God, shall exalt me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will praise the Name of God with a song, and magnify him with thanksgiving.
speaker: Narrator

text: This also shall please the Lord better than a young bullock that hath horns and hoofs.
speaker: Narrator

text: The humble shall see this, and they that seek God shall be glad, and your heart shall live.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord heareth the poor, and despiseth not his prisoners.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let heaven and earth praise him: the seas and all that moveth in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For God will save Zion, and build the cities of Judah, that men may dwell there and have it in possession.
speaker: Narrator

text: The seed also of his servants shall inherit it: and they that love his name shall dwell therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, haste thee to deliver me: make haste to help me, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be confounded and put to shame, that seek my soul: let them be turned backward and put to rebuke, that desire mine hurt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be turned back for a reward of their shame, which say, Aha, aha.
speaker: Narrator

text: But let all those that seek thee, be joyful and glad in thee, and let all that love thy salvation, say always, God be praised.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now I am poor and needy: O God, make haste to me: thou art my helper, and my deliverer: O Lord, make no tarrying.
speaker: Narrator

text: In thee, O Lord, I trust: let me never be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rescue me and deliver me in thy righteousness: incline thine ear unto me and save me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be thou my strong rock, whereunto I may always resort: thou hast given commandment to save me: for thou art my rock, and my fortress.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver me, O my God, out of the hand of the wicked: out of the hand of the evil and cruel man.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou art mine hope, O Lord God, even my trust from my youth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Upon thee have I been stayed from the womb: thou art he that took me out of my motherâ€™s bowels: my praise shall be always of thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am become as it were a monster unto many: but thou art my sure trust.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let my mouth be filled with thy praise, and with thy glory every day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cast me not off in the time of age: forsake me not when my strength faileth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For mine enemies speak of me, and they that lay wait for my soul, take their counsel together,
speaker: Narrator

text: Saying, God hath forsaken him: pursue and take him, for there is none to deliver him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go not far from me, O God: my God haste thee to help me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be confounded and consumed that are against my soul: let them be covered with reproof and confusion, that seek mine hurt.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will wait continually, and will praise thee more and more.
speaker: Narrator

text: My mouth shall daily rehearse thy righteousness, and thy salvation: for I know not the number.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will go forward in the strength of the Lord God, and will make mention of thy righteousness, even of thine only.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, thou hast taught me from my youth even until now: therefore will I tell of thy wondrous works,
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea even unto mine old age and gray head, O God: forsake me not, until I have declared thine arm unto this generation, and thy power to all them that shall come.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thy righteousness, O God, I will exalt on high: for thou hast done great things: O God, who is like unto thee!
speaker: Narrator

text: Which hast showed me great troubles and adversities, but thou wilt return and revive me, and wilt come again, and take me up from the depth of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou wilt increase mine honor, and return and comfort me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore will I praise thee for thy faithfulness, O God, upon instrument and viol: unto thee will I sing upon the harp, O Holy one of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: My lips will rejoice when I sing unto thee, and my soul which thou hast delivered.
speaker: Narrator

text: My tongue also shall talk of thy righteousness daily: for they are confounded and brought unto shame, that seek mine hurt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give thy judgments to the King, O God, and thy righteousness to the Kingâ€™s son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shall he judge thy people in righteousness, and thy poor with equity.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mountains, and the hills shall bring peace to the people by justice.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall judge the poor of the people: he shall save the children of the needy, and shall subdue the oppressor.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall fear thee as long as the sun and moon endureth, from generation to generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall come down like the rain upon the mown grass, and as the showers that water the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: In his days shall the righteous flourish, and abundance of peace shall be so long as the moon endureth.
speaker: Narrator

text: His dominion shall be also from sea to sea, and from the river unto the ends of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: They that dwell in the wilderness, shall kneel before him, and his enemies shall lick the dust.
speaker: Narrator

text: The kings of Tarshish and of the isles shall bring presents: the kings of Sheba and Seba shall bring gifts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, all kings shall worship him: all nations shall serve him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he shall deliver the poor when he crieth: the needy also, and him that hath no helper.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall be merciful to the poor and needy, and shall preserve the souls of the poor.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall redeem their souls from deceit and violence, and dear shall their blood be in his sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, he shall live, and unto him shall they give of the gold of Sheba: they shall also pray for him continually, and daily bless him.
speaker: Narrator

text: An handful of corn shall be sown in the earth, even in the top of the mountains, and the fruit thereof shalt shake like the trees of Lebanon: and the children shall flourish out of the city like the grass of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: His name shall be forever: his name shall endure as long as the Sun: all nations shall bless him, and be blessed in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be the Lord God, even the God of Israel which only doeth wondrous things.
speaker: Narrator

text: And blessed be his glorious Name forever: and let all the earth be filled with his glory. So be it, even so be it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Here end the prayers of David the son of Jesse.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet God is good to Israel: even to the pure in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for me, my feet were almost gone: my steps had well near slipped.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I fretted at the foolish, when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: For there are no bands in their death, but they are lusty and strong.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are not in trouble as other men, neither are they plagued with other men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore pride is as a chain unto them, and cruelty covereth them as a garment.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their eyes stand out for fatness: they have more than heart can wish.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are licentious, and speak wickedly of their oppression: they talk presumptuously.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set their mouth against heaven, and their tongue walketh through the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore his people turn hither: for waters of a full cup are wrung out to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they say, How doth God know it? or is there knowledge in the most High?
speaker: Narrator

text: Lo these are the wicked, yet prosper they always, and increase in riches.
speaker: Narrator

text: Certainly I have cleansed mine heart in vain, and washed mine hands in innocency.
speaker: Narrator

text: For daily have I been punished, and chastened every morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I say, I will judge thus, behold the generation of thy children, I have trespassed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thought I to know this, but it was too painful for me,
speaker: Narrator

text: Until I went into the Sanctuary of God: then understood I their end.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely thou hast set them in slippery places, and castest them down into desolation.
speaker: Narrator

text: How suddenly are they destroyed, perished and horribly consumed,
speaker: Narrator

text: As a dream when one awaketh! O Lord, when thou raisest us up, thou shalt make their image despised.
speaker: Narrator

text: Certainly mine heart was vexed, and I was pricked in my reins.
speaker: Narrator

text: So foolish was I and ignorant: I was a beast before thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet I was always with thee: thou hast holden me by my right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou wilt guide me by thy counsel, and afterward receive me to glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whom have I in heaven but thee? and I have desired none in the earth with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: My flesh faileth and mine heart also: but God is the strength of mine heart, and my portion forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: For lo, that they withdraw themselves from thee, shall perish: thou destroyest all them that go a whoring from thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for me, it is good for me to draw near to God: therefore I have put my trust in the Lord God, that I may declare all thy works.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, why hast thou put us away forever? why is thy wrath kindled against the sheep of thy pasture?
speaker: Narrator

text: Think upon the congregation, which thou hast possessed of old, and on the rod of thine inheritance, which thou hast redeemed, and on this mount Zion, wherein thou hast dwelt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up thy strokes, that thou mayest forever destroy every enemy that doeth evil to the Sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thine adversaries roar in the midst of thy congregation, and set up their banners for signs.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that lifted the axes upon the thick trees, was renowned as one that brought a thing to perfection:
speaker: Narrator

text: But now they break down the carved work thereof with axes and hammers.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have cast thy Sanctuary into the fire, and razed it to the ground, and have defiled the dwelling place of thy Name.
speaker: Narrator

text: They said in their hearts, Let us destroy them altogether: they have burnt all the Synagogues of God in the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: We see not our signs: there is not one Prophet more, nor any with us that knoweth how long.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, how long shall the adversary reproach thee? shall the enemy blaspheme thy Name forever?
speaker: Narrator

text: Why withdrawest thou thine hand, even thy right hand? draw it out of thy bosom, and consume them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even God is my king of old, working salvation in the midst of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou didst divide the sea by thy power: thou brakest the heads of the dragons in the waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou brakest the head of Leviathan in pieces, and gavest him to be meat for the people in wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou brakest up the fountain and river: thou driest up mighty rivers.
speaker: Narrator

text: The day is thine, and the night is thine: thou hast prepared the light and the sun.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast set all the borders of the earth: thou hast made Summer and Winter.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember this, that the enemy hath reproached the Lord, and the foolish people hath blasphemed thy Name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give not the soul of thy turtle dove unto the beast, and forget not the Congregation of thy poor forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Consider thy covenant: for the dark places of the earth are full of the habitations of the cruel.
speaker: Narrator

text: O let not the oppressed return ashamed, but let the poor and needy praise thy Name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, O God: maintain thy own cause: remember thy daily reproach by the foolish man.
speaker: Narrator

text: Forget not the voice of thine enemies: for the tumult of them that rise against thee, ascendeth continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: We will praise thee, O God, we will praise thee, for thy Name is near: therefore they will declare thy wondrous works.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I shall take a convenient time, I will judge righteously.
speaker: Narrator

text: The earth and all the inhabitants thereof are dissolved: but I will establish the pillars of it. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: I said unto the foolish, Be not so foolish, and to the wicked, Lift not up the horn.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift not up your horn on high, neither speak with a stiff neck.
speaker: Narrator

text: For to come to preferment is neither from the East, nor from the West, nor from the South,
speaker: Narrator

text: But God is the judge: he maketh low, and he maketh high.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in the hand of the Lord is a cup, and the wine is red: it is full mixed, and he poureth out of the same: surely all the wicked of the earth shall wring out and drink the dregs thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will declare forever, and sing praises unto the God of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the horns of the wicked also will I break: but the horns of the righteous shall be exalted.
speaker: Narrator

text: God is known in Judah: his Name is great in Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in Salem is his Tabernacle, and his dwelling in Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: There brake he the arrows of the bow, the shield, and the sword, and the battle. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou art more bright and puissant, than the mountains of prey.
speaker: Narrator

text: The stouthearted are spoiled: they have slept their sleep, and all the men of strength have not found their hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: At thy rebuke, O God of Jacob, both the chariot and horse are cast asleep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou, even thou art to be feared; and who shall stand in thy sight, when thou art angry!
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou didst cause thy judgment to be heard from heaven; therefore the earth feared, and was still,
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou, O God, arose to judgment, to help all the meek of the earth. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely the rage of man shall turn to thy praise; the remnant of the rage shalt thou restrain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Vow and perform unto the Lord your God, all ye that be round about him; let them bring presents unto him that ought to be feared.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall cut off the spirit of princes; he is terrible to the kings of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: My voice came to God, when I cried: my voice came to God; and he heard me.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord: my sore ran and ceased not in the night: my soul refused comfort.
speaker: Narrator

text: I did think upon God, and was troubled: I prayed, and my spirit was full of anguish. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou keepest mine eyes waking: I was astonied, and could not speak.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I considered the days of old: and the years of ancient time.
speaker: Narrator

text: I called to remembrance my song in the night: I communed with mine own heart, and my spirit searched diligently.
speaker: Narrator

text: Will the Lord absent himself forever? and will he show no more favor?
speaker: Narrator

text: Is his mercy clean gone forever? doth his promise fail forevermore?
speaker: Narrator

text: Hath God forgotten to be merciful? hath he shut up his tender mercies in displeasure? Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I said, This is my death: yet I remembered the years of the right hand of the most High.
speaker: Narrator

text: I remembered the works of the Lord: certainly I remembered thy wonders of old.
speaker: Narrator

text: I did also meditate all thy works, and did devise of thine acts, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy way, O God, is in the Sanctuary: who is so great a God, as our God!
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou art the God that doest wonders; thou hast declared thy power among the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast redeemed thy people with thine arm, even the sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The waters saw thee, O God: the waters saw thee, and were afraid: yea, the depths trembled.
speaker: Narrator

text: The clouds poured out water: the heavens gave a sound: yea, thine arrows went abroad.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of thy thunder was round about; the lightnings lightened the world: the earth trembled and shook.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy way is in the sea, and thy paths in the great waters, and thy footsteps are not known.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou didst lead thy people like sheep by the hand of Moses and Aaron.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear my doctrine, O my people: incline your ears unto the words of my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will open my mouth in a parable: I will declare high sentences of old.
speaker: Narrator

text: Which we have heard and known, and our fathers have told us.
speaker: Narrator

text: We will not hide them from their children, but to the generation to come we will show the praise of the Lord, his power also, and his wonderful works that he hath done:
speaker: Narrator

text: How he established a testimony in Jacob, and ordained a Law in Israel, which he commanded our fathers, that they should teach their children:
speaker: Narrator

text: That the posterity might know it, and the children, which should be born, should stand up, and declare it to their children.
speaker: Narrator

text: That they might set their hope on God, and not forget the works of God, but keep his commandments:
speaker: Narrator

text: And not to be as their fathers, a disobedient and rebellious generation: a generation that set not their heart aright, and whose spirit was not faithful unto God.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children of Ephraim being armed and shooting with the bow, turned back in the day of battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: They kept not the Covenant of God, but refused to walk in his Law,
speaker: Narrator

text: And forgate his acts, and his wonderful works that he had showed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: He did marvelous things in the sight of their fathers in the land of Egypt; even in the field of Zoan.
speaker: Narrator

text: He divided the Sea, and led them through: he made also the waters to stand as an heap.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the daytime also he led them with a cloud, and all the night with a light of fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: He clave the rocks in the wilderness, and gave them drink as of the great depths.
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought floods also out of the stony rock, so that he made the waters to descend like the rivers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet they sinned still against him, and provoked the Highest in the wilderness,
speaker: Narrator

text: And tempted God in their hearts in requiring meat for their lust.
speaker: Narrator

text: They spake against God also, saying, Can God prepare a table in the wilderness?
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, he smote the rock, that the water gushed out, and the streams overflowed: can he give bread also? or prepare flesh for his people?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the Lord heard, and was angry, and the fire was kindled in Jacob, and also wrath came upon Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: Because they believed not in God, and trusted not in his help.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet he had commanded the clouds above, and had opened the doors of heaven,
speaker: Narrator

text: And had rained down Manna upon them for to eat, and had given them of the wheat of heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Man did eat the bread of Angels: he sent them meat enough.
speaker: Narrator

text: He caused the East wind to pass in the heaven: and through his power he brought in the South wind.
speaker: Narrator

text: He rained flesh also upon them as dust, and feathered fowl as the sand of the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made it fall in the midst of their camp, even round about their habitations.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they did eat, and were well filled: for he gave them their desire.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were not turned from their lusts, but the meat was yet in their mouths,
speaker: Narrator

text: When the wrath of God came even upon them, and slew the strongest of them, and smote down the chosen men of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all this they sinned still, and believed not his wondrous works.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore their days did he consume in vanity, and their years hastily.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he slew them, they sought him, and they returned, and sought God early.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they remembered that God was their strength, and the most high God their redeemer.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they flattered him with their mouth, and dissembled with him with their tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text: For their heart was not upright with him: neither were they faithful in his covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet he being merciful, forgave their iniquity, and destroyed them not, but oft times called back his anger, and did not stir up all his wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he remembered that they were flesh: yea, a wind that passeth and cometh not again.
speaker: Narrator

text: How oft did they provoke him in the wilderness? and grieve him in the desert?
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, they returned and tempted God, and limited the Holy one of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: They remembered not his hand, nor the day when he delivered them from the enemy,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nor him that set his signs in Egypt, and his wonders in the field of Zoan,
speaker: Narrator

text: And turned their rivers into blood, and their floods, that they could not drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent a swarm of flies among them, which devoured them, and frogs, which destroyed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gave also their fruits unto the caterpillar, and their labor unto the grasshopper.
speaker: Narrator

text: He destroyed their vines with hail, and their wild fig trees with the hailstone.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gave their cattle also to the hail, and their flocks to the thunderbolts.
speaker: Narrator

text: He cast upon them the fierceness of his anger, indignation and wrath, and vexation by the sending out of evil angels.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made a way to his anger: he spared not their soul from death, but gave their life to the pestilence,
speaker: Narrator

text: And smote all the firstborn in Egypt, even the beginning of their strength in the tabernacles of Ham.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he made his people to go out like sheep, and led them in the wilderness like a flock.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, he carried them out safely, and they feared not, and the Sea covered their enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he brought them unto the borders of his Sanctuary: even to this Mountain which his right hand purchased.
speaker: Narrator

text: He cast out the heathen also before them, and caused them to fall to the lot of his inheritance, and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tabernacles.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet they tempted, and provoked the most high God, and kept not his testimonies,
speaker: Narrator

text: But turned back, and dealt falsely like their fathers: they turned like a deceitful bow.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they provoked him to anger with their high places, and moved him to wrath with their graven images.
speaker: Narrator

text: God heard this and was wroth, and greatly abhorred Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: So that he forsook the habitation of Shiloh, even the Tabernacle where he dwelt among men,
speaker: Narrator

text: And delivered his power into captivity, and his beauty into the enemyâ€™s hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he gave up his people to the sword, and was angry with his inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fire devoured their chosen men, and their maids were not praised.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their Priests fell by the sword, and their widows lamented not.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord awaked as one out of sleep, and as a strong man that after his wine crieth out,
speaker: Narrator

text: And smote his enemies in the hinder parts, and put them to a perpetual shame.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet he refused the tabernacle of Joseph, and chose not the tribe of Ephraim:
speaker: Narrator

text: But chose the tribe of Judah, and mount Zion which he loved.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he built his Sanctuary as an high palace, like the earth, which he established forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: He chose David also his servant, and took him from the sheepfolds.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even from behind the ewes with young, brought he him to feed his people in Jacob, and his inheritance in Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he fed them according to the simplicity of his heart, and guided them by the discretion of his hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, the heathen are come into thine inheritance: thine holy Temple have they defiled, and made Jerusalem heaps of stones.
speaker: Narrator

text: The dead bodies of thy servants have they given to be meat unto fowls of the heaven, and the flesh of thy saints unto the beasts of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their blood have they shed like waters, round about Jerusalem, and there was none to bury them.
speaker: Narrator

text: We are a reproach to our neighbors, even a scorn and derision unto them that are round about us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, how long wilt thou be angry, forever? shall thy jealousy burn like fire?
speaker: Narrator

text: Pour out thy wrath upon the heathen that have not known thee, and upon the kingdoms that have not called upon thy Name.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they have devoured Jacob, and made his dwelling place desolate.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember not against us the former iniquities, but make haste, and let thy tender mercies prevent us: for we are in great misery.
speaker: Narrator

text: Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of thy Name, and deliver us, and be merciful unto our sins for thy Nameâ€™s sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore should the heathen say, Where is their God? let them be known among the heathen in our sight by the vengeance of the blood of thy servants that is shed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the sighing of the prisoners come before thee: according to thy mighty arm preserve the children of death,
speaker: Narrator

text: And render to our neighbors sevenfold into their bosom their reproach, wherewith they have reproached thee, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: So we thy people, and sheep of thy pasture shall praise thee forever: and from generation to generation we will set forth thy praise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, O thou shepherd of Israel, thou that leadest Joseph like sheep: show thy brightness, thou that sittest between the Cherubims.
speaker: Narrator

text: Before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh stir up thy strength, and come to help us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn us again, O God, and cause thy face to shine that we may be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord God of hosts, how long wilt thou be angry against the prayer of thy people?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast fed them with the bread of tears, and given them tears to drink with great measure.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast made us a strife unto our neighbors, and our enemies laugh at us among themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn us again, O God of hosts: cause thy face to shine, and we shall be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast brought a vine out of Egypt: thou hast cast out the heathen, and planted it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou madest room for it, and didst cause it to take root, and it filled the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mountains were covered with the shadow of it, and the boughs thereof were like the goodly cedars.
speaker: Narrator

text: She stretched out her branches unto the Sea, and her boughs unto the river.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why hast thou then broken down her hedges, so that all they, which pass by the way, have plucked her?
speaker: Narrator

text: The wild boar out of the wood hath destroyed it, and the wild beasts of the field have eaten it up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Return, we beseech thee, O God of hosts: look down from heaven and behold, and visit this vine,
speaker: Narrator

text: And the vineyard, that thy right hand hath planted, and the young vine, which thou madest strong for thyself.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is burnt with fire, and cut down: and they perish at the rebuke of thy countenance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let thine hand be upon the man of thy right hand, and upon the son of man, whom thou madest strong for thine own self.
speaker: Narrator

text: So will not we go back from thee, revive thou us, and we shall call upon thy Name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn us again, O Lord God of hosts: cause thy face to shine, and we shall be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing joyfully unto God our strength: sing loud unto the God of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take the song and bring forth the timbrel, the pleasant harp with the viol.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blow the trumpet in the new moon, even in the time appointed at our feast day.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this is a statute for Israel, and a Law of the God of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: He set this in Joseph for a testimony, when he came out of the land of Egypt, where I heard a language, that I understood not.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have withdrawn his shoulder from the burden, and his hands have left the pots.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou calledst in affliction, and I delivered thee, and answered thee in the secret of the thunder: I proved thee at the waters of Meribah. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, O my people, and I will protest unto thee: O Israel, if thou wilt hearken unto me,
speaker: Narrator

text: And wilt have no strange god in thee, neither worship any strange god,
speaker: Narrator

text: (For I am the Lord thy God, which brought thee out of the land of Egypt:) open thy mouth wide, and I will fill it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But my people would not hear my voice, and Israel would none of me,
speaker: Narrator

text: So I gave them up unto the hardness of their heart, and they have walked in their own counsels.
speaker: Narrator

text: Oh that my people had hearkened unto me, and Israel had walked in my ways!
speaker: Narrator

text: I would soon have humbled their enemies, and turned mine hand against their adversaries.
speaker: Narrator

text: The haters of the Lord should have been subject unto him, and their time should have endured forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God would have fed them with the fat of wheat, and with honey out of the rock would I have sufficed thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: God standeth in the assembly of gods: he judgeth among gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: How long will ye judge unjustly, and accept the persons of the wicked? Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do right to the poor and fatherless: do justice to the poor and needy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver the poor and needy: save them from the hand of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: They know not and understand nothing: they walk in darkness, albeit all the foundations of the earth be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have said, Ye are gods, and ye all are children of the most High.
speaker: Narrator

text: But ye shall die as a man, and ye princes shall fall like others.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, arise, therefore judge thou the earth: for thou shalt inherit all nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep not thou silence, O God: be not still, and cease not, O God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For lo, thine enemies make a tumult, and they that hate thee, have lifted up the head.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have taken crafty counsel against thy people, and have consulted against thy secret ones.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have said, Come and let us cut them off from being a nation: and let the name of Israel be no more in remembrance.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they have consulted together in heart, and have made a league against thee:
speaker: Narrator

text: The tabernacles of Edom, and the Ishmaelites, Moab and the Hagarites:
speaker: Narrator

text: Gebal and Ammon, and Amalek, the Philistines, with the inhabitants of Tyre.
speaker: Narrator

text: Assyria also is joined with them: they have been an arm to the children of Lot. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do thou to them as unto the Midianites: as to Sisera and as to Jabin at the river of Kishon.
speaker: Narrator

text: They perished at En Dor, and were dung for the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make them, even their princes, like Oreb and like Zeeb: yea, all their princes like Zebah and like Zalmunna,
speaker: Narrator

text: Which have said, Let us take for our possession the habitations of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: O my God, make them like unto a wheel, and as the stubble before the wind.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the fire burneth the forest, and as the flame setteth the mountains on fire:
speaker: Narrator

text: So persecute them with thy tempest, and make them afraid with thy storm.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fill their faces with shame, that they may seek thy Name, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be confounded and troubled forever: yea, let them be put to shame, and perish,
speaker: Narrator

text: That they may know that thou, which art calleth Jehovah, art alone, even the most High over all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord of hosts, how amiable are thy Tabernacles?
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul longeth, yea, and fainted for the courts of the Lord: for my heart and my flesh rejoice in the living God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, the sparrow hath found her an house, and the swallow a nest for her, where she may lay her young: even by thine altars, O Lord of hosts, my king and my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed are they that dwell in thine house, they will ever praise thee. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is the man whose strength is in thee, and in whose heart are thy ways.
speaker: Narrator
