text: They going through the valley of Baca, make wells therein: the rain also covereth the pools.
speaker: Narrator

text: They go from strength to strength, till every one appear before God in Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord God of hosts, hear my prayer, hearken, O God of Jacob. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, O God, our shield, and look upon the face of thine Anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text: For a day in thy courts is better than a thousand other where: I had rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God, than to dwell in the tabernacles of wickedness.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord God is the sun and shield unto us: the Lord will give grace and glory, and no good thing will he withhold from them that walk uprightly.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord of hosts, blessed is the man that trusteth in thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, thou hast been favorable unto thy land: thou hast brought again the captivity of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast forgiven the iniquity of thy people, and covered all their sins. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast withdrawn all thine anger, and hast turned back from the fierceness of thy wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn us, O God of our salvation, and release thine anger toward us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wilt thou be angry with us forever? and wilt thou prolong thy wrath from one generation to another?
speaker: Narrator

text: Wilt thou not turn again and quicken us, that thy people may rejoice in thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: Show us thy mercy, O Lord, and grant us thy salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will hearken what the Lord God will say: for he will speak peace unto his people, and to his Saints, that they turn not again to folly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely his salvation is near to them that fear him, that glory may dwell in our land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mercy and truth shall meet, righteousness and peace shall kiss one another.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truth shall bud out of the earth, and righteousness shall look down from heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, the Lord shall give good things, and our land shall give her increase.
speaker: Narrator

text: Righteousness shall go before him, and shall set her steps in the way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Incline thine ear, O Lord, and hear me: for I am poor and needy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Preserve thou my soul, for I am merciful: my God, save thou thy servant, that trusteth in thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be merciful unto me, O Lord: for I cry upon thee continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoice the soul of thy servant: for unto thee, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou, Lord, art good and merciful, and of great kindness unto all them that call upon thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give ear, Lord, unto my prayer, and hearken to the voice of my supplication.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the day of my trouble I will call upon thee: for thou hearest me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Among the gods there is none like thee, O Lord, and there is none that can do like thy works.
speaker: Narrator

text: All nations whom thou hast made, shall come and worship before thee, O Lord, and shall glorify thy Name.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou art great and doest wondrous things: thou art God alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: Teach me thy way, O Lord, and I will walk in thy truth: knit mine heart unto thee, that I may fear thy Name.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will praise thee, O Lord my God, with all mine heart: yea, I will glorify thy Name forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: For great is thy mercy toward me, and thou hast delivered my soul from the lowest grave.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, the proud are risen against me, and the assemblies of violent men have sought my soul, and have not set thee before them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou, O Lord, art a pitiful God and merciful, slow to anger, and great in kindness and truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn unto me, and have mercy upon me: give thy strength unto thy servant, and save the son of thine handmaid.
speaker: Narrator

text: Show a token of thy goodness toward me, that they which hate me, may see it, and be ashamed, because thou, O Lord, hast helped me and comforted me.
speaker: Narrator

text: God laid his foundations among the holy mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord loveth the gates of Zion above all the habitations of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Glorious things are spoken of thee, O city of God. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will make mention of Rahab and Babel among them that know me: behold Palestine and Tyre with Ethiopia, There is he born.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of Zion it shall be said, Many are born in her: and he, even the most High shall stablish her.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord shall count, when he writeth the people, He was born there. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: As well the singers as the players on instruments shall praise thee: all my springs are in thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord God of my salvation, I cry day and night before thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let my prayer enter into thy presence: incline thine ear unto my cry.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my soul is filled with evils, and my life draweth near to the grave.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am counted among them that go down unto the pit, and am as a man without strength,
speaker: Narrator

text: Free among the dead, like the slain laying in the grave, when thou rememberest no more, and they are cut off from thy hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast laid me in the lowest pit, in darkness, and in the deep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thine indignation lieth upon me, and thou hast vexed me with all thy waves. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast put away mine acquaintance far from me, and made me to be abhorred of them: I am shut up, and cannot get forth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine eye is sorrowful through mine affliction: Lord, I call daily upon thee: I stretch out mine hands unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wilt thou show a miracle to the dead? or shall the dead rise and praise thee? Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shall thy loving kindness be declared in the grave? or thy faithfulness in destruction?
speaker: Narrator

text: Shall thy wondrous works be known in the dark? and thy righteousness in the land of oblivion?
speaker: Narrator

text: But unto thee, have I cried, O Lord, and early shall my prayer come before thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, why dost thou reject my soul, and hidest thy face from me?
speaker: Narrator

text: I am afflicted and at the point of death: from my youth I suffer thy terrors, doubting of my life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thine indignations go over me, and thy fear hath cut me off.
speaker: Narrator

text: They came round about me daily like water, and compassed me together.
speaker: Narrator

text: My lovers and friends hast thou put away from me, and mine acquaintance hid themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will sing the mercies of the Lord forever: with my mouth will I declare thy truth from generation to generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I said, Mercy shall be set up forever: thy truth shalt thou stablish in the very heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have made a covenant with my chosen: I have sworn to David my servant,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy seed will I stablish forever, and set up thy throne from generation to generation. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, even the heavens shall praise thy wondrous work: yea, thy truth in the Congregation of the Saints.
speaker: Narrator

text: For who is equal to the Lord in the heaven? and who is like the Lord among the sons of the gods?
speaker: Narrator

text: God is very terrible in the assembly of the Saints, and to be reverenced above all that are about him.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord God of hosts, who is like unto thee, which art a mighty Lord, and thy truth is about thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou rulest the raging of the Sea: when the waves thereof arise, thou stillest them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast beaten down Rahab as a man slain: thou hast scattered thine enemies with thy mighty arm.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heavens are thine, the earth also is thine: thou hast laid the foundation of the world, and all that therein is.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast created the North and the South: Tabor and Hermon shall rejoice in thy Name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast a mighty arm: strong is thy hand, and high is thy right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Righteousness and equity are the stablishment of thy throne: mercy and truth go before thy face.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is the people that can rejoice in thee: they shall walk in the light of thy countenance, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall rejoice continually in thy Name, and in thy righteousness shall they exalt themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou art the glory of their strength, and by thy favor our horns shall be exalted.
speaker: Narrator

text: For our shield appertaineth to the Lord, and our King to the Holy one of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou spakest then in a vision unto thine Holy one, and saidest, I have laid help upon one that is mighty: I have exalted one chosen out of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have found David my servant: with mine holy oil have I anointed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore mine hand shall be established with him, and mine arm shall strengthen him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The enemy shall not oppress him, neither shall the wicked hurt him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will destroy his foes before his face, and plague them that hate him.
speaker: Narrator

text: My truth also and my mercy shall be with him, and in my Name shall his horn be exalted.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will set his hand also in the sea, and his right hand in the floods.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall cry unto me, Thou art my Father, my God, and the rock of my salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also I will make him my firstborn, higher than the kings of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: My mercy will I keep for him for evermore, and my Covenant shall stand fast with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: His seed also will I make to endure forever, and his throne as the days of heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if his children forsake my Law, and walk not in my judgments:
speaker: Narrator

text: If they break my statutes, and keep not my commandments:
speaker: Narrator

text: Then will I visit their transgression with the rod, and their iniquity with strokes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet my loving kindness will I not take from him, neither will I falsify my truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: My Covenant will I not break, nor alter the thing that is gone out of my lips.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have sworn once by mine holiness, that I will not fail David, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: His seed shall endure forever, and his throne shall be as the sun before me.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall be established for evermore as the moon, and as a faithful witness in the heaven. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou hast rejected and abhorred, thou hast been angry with thine anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast broken the Covenant of thy servant, and profaned his crown, casting it on the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast broken down all his walls: thou hast laid his fortresses in ruin.
speaker: Narrator

text: All that go by the way, spoil him: he is a rebuke unto his neighbors.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast set up the right hand of his enemies, and made all his adversaries to rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast also turned the edge of his sword, and hast not made him to stand in the battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast caused his dignity to decay, and cast his throne to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: The days of his youth hast thou shortened, and covered him with shame. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, how long wilt thou hide thyself, forever? shall thy wrath burn like fire?
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember of what time I am: wherefore shouldest thou create in vain all the children of men?
speaker: Narrator

text: What man liveth, and shall not see death? shall he deliver his soul from the hand of the grave? Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, where are thy former mercies, which thou swarest unto David in thy truth?
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember, O Lord, the rebuke of thy servants, which I bear in my bosom of all the mighty people.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thine enemies have reproached thee, O Lord, because they have reproached the footsteps of thine Anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praised be the Lord for evermore. So be it, even so be it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, thou hast been our habitation from generation to generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Before the mountains were made, and before thou hadst formed the earth, and the world, even from everlasting to everlasting thou art our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou turnest man to destruction: again thou sayest, Return ye sons of Adam.
speaker: Narrator

text: For a thousand years in thy sight are as yesterday when it is past, and as a watch in the night.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast overflowed them, they are as a sleep, in the morning he groweth like the grass:
speaker: Narrator

text: In the morning it flourisheth and groweth, but in the evening it is cut down and withereth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we are consumed by thine anger, and by thy wrath are we troubled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast set our iniquities before thee, and our secret sins in the light of thy countenance.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all our days are past in thine anger: we have spent our years as a thought.
speaker: Narrator

text: The time of our life is threescore years and ten, and if they be of strength, fourscore years: yet their strength is but labor and sorrow: for it is cut off quickly, and we flee away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who knoweth the power of thy wrath? for according to thy fear is thine anger.
speaker: Narrator

text: Teach us so to number our days, that we may apply our hearts unto wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Return (O Lord, how long?) and be pacified toward thy servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fill us with thy mercy in the morning: so shall we rejoice and be glad all our days?
speaker: Narrator

text: Comfort us according to the days that thou hast afflicted us, and according to the years that we have seen evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let thy work be seen toward thy servants, and thy glory upon their children.
speaker: Narrator

text: And let the beauty of the Lord our God be upon us, and direct thou the work of our hands upon us, even direct the work of our hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who so dwelleth in the secret of the most High, shall abide in the shadow of the Almighty.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will say unto the Lord, O my hope, and my fortress: he is my God, in him will I trust.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely I will deliver thee from the snare of the hunter, and from the noisome pestilence.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will cover thee under his wings, and thou shalt be sure under his feathers: his truth shall be thy shield and buckler.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not be afraid of the fear of the night: nor of the arrow that flieth by day:
speaker: Narrator

text: Nor of the pestilence that walketh in the darkness: nor of the plague that destroyeth at noon day.
speaker: Narrator

text: A thousand shall fall at thy side, and ten thousand at thy right hand, but it shall not come near thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Doubtless with thine eyes shalt thou behold and see the reward of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou hast said, The Lord is mine hope: thou hast set the most High for thy refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text: There shall none evil come unto thee, neither shall any plague come near thy tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he shall give his Angels charge over thee to keep thee in all thy ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall bear thee in their hands, that thou hurt not thy foot against a stone.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt walk upon the lion and asp: the young lion, and the dragon shalt thou tread under feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because he hath loved me, therefore will I deliver him: I will exalt him because he hath known my Name.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall call upon me, and I will hear him: I will be with him in trouble: I will deliver him, and glorify him.
speaker: Narrator

text: With long life will I satisfy him, and show him my salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is a good thing to praise the Lord, and to sing unto thy Name, O most High,
speaker: Narrator

text: To declare thy loving kindness in the morning, and thy truth in the night,
speaker: Narrator

text: Upon an instrument of ten strings, and upon the viol, with the song upon the harp.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou Lord, hast made me glad by thy works, and I will rejoice in the works of thine hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, how glorious are thy works! and thy thoughts are very deep.
speaker: Narrator

text: An unwise man knoweth it not, and a fool doth not understand this,
speaker: Narrator

text: (When the wicked grow as the grass, and all the workers of wickedness do flourish) that they shall be destroyed forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou, O Lord, art most High forevermore.
speaker: Narrator

text: For lo, thine enemies, O Lord: for lo, thine enemies shall perish: all the workers of iniquity shall be destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou shalt exalt mine horn, like the unicorns, and I shall be anointed with fresh oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine eye also shall see my desire against mine enemies: and mine ears shall hear my wish against the wicked, that rise up against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous shall flourish like a palm tree, and shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Such as be planted in the house of the Lord, shall flourish in the courts of our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall still bring forth fruit in their age: they shall be fat and flourishing,
speaker: Narrator

text: To declare that the Lord my rock is righteous, and that none iniquity is in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord reigneth, and is clothed with majesty: the Lord is clothed, and girded with power, the world also shall be established, that it cannot be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy throne is established of old: thou art from everlasting.
speaker: Narrator

text: The floods have lifted up, O Lord: the floods have lifted up their voice: the floods lift up their waves.
speaker: Narrator

text: The waves of the sea are marvelous through the noise of many waters, yet the Lord on high is more mighty.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy testimonies are very sure: holiness becometh thine House, O Lord, forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord God the avenger, O God the avenger, show thyself clearly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Exalt thyself, O Judge of the world, and render a reward to the proud.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, how long shall the wicked, how long shall the wicked triumph?
speaker: Narrator

text: They prate and speak fiercely: all the workers of iniquity vaunt themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: They smite down thy people, O Lord, and trouble thine heritage.
speaker: Narrator

text: They slay the widow and the stranger, and murder the fatherless.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet they say, The Lord shall not see: neither will the God of Jacob regard it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Understand, ye unwise among the people: and ye fools, when will ye be wise?
speaker: Narrator

text: He that planted the ear, shall he not hear? or he that formed the eye, shall he not see?
speaker: Narrator

text: Or he that chastiseth the nations, shall he not correct? he that teacheth man knowledge, shall he not know?
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord knoweth the thoughts of man, that they are vanity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is the man whom thou chastisest, O Lord, and teachest him in thy Law,
speaker: Narrator

text: That thou mayest give him rest from the days of evil, while the pit is dug for the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely the Lord will not fail his people, neither will he forsake his inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: For judgment shall return to justice, and all the upright in heart shall follow after it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who will rise up with me against the wicked? or who will take my part against the workers of iniquity?
speaker: Narrator

text: If the Lord had not helped me, my soul had almost dwelt in silence.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I said, My foot slideth, thy mercy, O Lord, stayed me.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the multitude of my thoughts in mine heart, thy comforts have rejoiced my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hath the throne of iniquity fellowship with thee, which forgeth wrong for a Law?
speaker: Narrator

text: They gather them together against the soul of the righteous, and condemn the innocent blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord is my refuge, and my God is the rock of mine hope.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he will recompense them their wickedness, and destroy them in their own malice, yea, the Lord our God shall destroy them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come, let us rejoice unto the Lord: let us sing aloud unto the rock of our salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let us come before his face with praise: let us sing loud unto him with Psalms.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord is a great God, and a great King above all gods,
speaker: Narrator

text: In whose hand are the deep places of the earth, and the heights of the mountains are his,
speaker: Narrator

text: To whom the Sea belongeth, for he made it, and his hands formed the dry land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come, let us worship and fall down, and kneel before the Lord our maker.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he is our God, and we are the people of his pasture, and the sheep of his hand: today, if ye will hear his voice,
speaker: Narrator

text: Harden not your heart, as in Meribah, and as in the day of Massah in the wilderness,
speaker: Narrator

text: When your fathers tempted me, proved me, though they had seen my work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Forty years have I contended with this generation, and said, They are a people that err in heart, for they have not known my ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore I sware in my wrath, saying, Surely they shall not enter into my rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing unto the Lord a new song: sing unto the Lord all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing unto the Lord, and praise his Name: declare his salvation from day to day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Declare his glory among all nations, and his wonders among all people.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord is great and much to be praised: he is to be feared above all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all the gods of the people are idols: but the Lord made the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: Strength and glory are before him: power and beauty are in his Sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give unto the Lord, ye families of the people: give unto the Lord glory and power.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give unto the Lord the glory of his Name: bring an offering, and enter into his courts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Worship the Lord in the glorious Sanctuary: tremble before him all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Say among the Nations, The Lord reigneth: Surely the world shall be stable, and not move, and he shall judge the people in righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad: let the sea roar, and all that therein is.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the field be joyful, and all that is in it: let all the trees of the wood then rejoice,
speaker: Narrator

text: Before the Lord: for he cometh, for he cometh to judge the earth: he will judge the world with righteousness, and the people in his truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord reigneth: let the earth rejoice: let the multitude of the Isles be glad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Clouds and darkness are round about him: righteousness and judgment are the foundation of his throne.
speaker: Narrator

text: There shall go a fire before him, and burn up his enemies round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: His lightnings gave light unto the world: the earth saw it and was afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mountains melted like wax at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heavens declare his righteousness, and all the people see his glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: Confounded be all they that serve graven images, and that glory in idols: worship him all ye gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zion heard of it, and was glad: and the daughters of Judah rejoiced, because of thy judgments, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou, Lord, art most High above all the earth: thou art much exalted above all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye that love the Lord, hate evil: he preserveth the souls of his Saints: he will deliver them from the hand of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: Light is sown for the righteous, and joy for the upright in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoice ye righteous in the Lord, and give thanks for his holy remembrance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing unto the Lord a new song: for he hath done marvelous things: his right hand, and his holy arm have gotten him the victory.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord declared his salvation: his righteousness hath he revealed in the sight of the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath remembered his mercy and his truth toward the house of Israel: all the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the earth, sing ye loud unto the Lord: cry out and rejoice, and sing praises.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing praise to the Lord upon the harp, even upon the harp with a singing voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: With shalms and sound of trumpets sing loud before the Lord the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the sea roar, and all that therein is, the world, and they that dwell therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the floods clap their hands, and let the mountains rejoice together,
speaker: Narrator

text: Before the Lord: for he is come to judge the earth: with righteousness shall he judge the world: and the people with equity.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord reigneth, let the people tremble: he sitteth between the Cherubims, let the earth be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is great in Zion, and he is high above all the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall praise thy great and fearful Name (for it is holy.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Kingâ€™s power, that loveth judgment: for thou hast prepared equity: thou hast executed judgment and justice in Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Exalt the Lord our God, and fall down before his footstool: for he is holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses and Aaron were among his Priests, and Samuel among such as call upon his Name: these called upon the Lord, and he heard them.
speaker: Narrator

text: He spake unto them in the cloudy pillar: they kept his testimonies, and the Law that he gave them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou heardest them, O Lord our God: thou wast a favorable God unto them, though thou didst take vengeance for their inventions.
speaker: Narrator

text: Exalt the Lord our God and fall down before his holy Mountain: for the Lord our God is holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing ye loud unto the Lord, all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Serve the Lord with gladness; come before him with joyfulness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Know ye that even the Lord is God; he hath made us, and not we ourselves: we are his people, and the sheep of his pasture.
speaker: Narrator

text: Enter into his gates with praise, and into his courts with rejoicing: praise him and bless his Name.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord is good: his mercy is everlasting, and his truth is from generation to generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will sing mercy and judgment: unto thee, O Lord, will I sing.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will do wisely in the perfect way, till thou comest to me, I will walk in the uprightness of mine heart in the midst of my house.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will set no wicked thing before mine eyes: I hate the work of them that fall away: it shall not cleave unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: A froward heart shall depart from me; I will know none evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Him that privily slandereth his neighbor, will I destroy: him that hath a proud look and high heart, I cannot suffer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine eyes shall be unto the faithful of the land, that they may dwell with me: he that walketh in a perfect way, he shall serve me.
speaker: Narrator

text: There shall no deceitful person dwell within my house: he that telleth lies, shall not remain in my sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Betimes will I destroy all the wicked of the land that I may cut off all the workers of iniquity from the City of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord hear my prayer, and let my cry come unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hide not thy face from me in the time of my trouble: incline thine ears unto me, when I call, make haste to hear me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my days are consumed like smoke, and my bones are burnt like an hearth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine heart is smitten, and withered like grass, because I forgat to eat my bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the voice of my groaning, my bones do cleave to my skin.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am like a pelican of the wilderness: I am like an owl of the deserts.
speaker: Narrator

text: I watch, and am as a sparrow alone upon the house top.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine enemies revile me daily, and they that rage against me, have sworn against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely I have eaten ashes as bread, and mingled my drink with weeping,
speaker: Narrator

text: Because of thine indignation and thy wrath: for thou hast heaved me up, and cast me down.
speaker: Narrator

text: My days are like a shadow that fadeth, and I am withered like grass.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou, O Lord, dost remain forever, and thy remembrance from generation to generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou wilt arise and have mercy upon Zion: for the time to have mercy thereon, for the appointed time is come.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thy servants delight in the stones thereof, and have pity on the dust thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the heathen shall fear the Name of the Lord, and all the kings of the earth thy glory,
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Lord shall build up Zion, and shall appear in his glory,
speaker: Narrator

text: And shall turn unto the prayer of the desolate, and not despise their prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: This shall be written for the generation to come: and the people which shall be created, shall praise the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he hath looked down from the height of his Sanctuary: out of the heaven did the Lord behold the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text: That he might hear the mourning of the prisoner, and deliver the children of death.
speaker: Narrator

text: That they may declare the Name of the Lord in Zion, and his praise in Jerusalem,
speaker: Narrator

text: When the people shall be gathered together, and the kingdoms to serve the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: He abated my strength in the way, and shortened my days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I said, O my God, take me not away in the midst of my days: thy years endure from generation to generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast aforetime laid the foundation of the earth, and the heavens are the work of thine hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall perish, but thou shalt endure: even they all shall wax old as doth a garment: as a vesture shalt thou change them, and they shall be changed.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou art the same, and thy years shall not fail.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children of thy servants shall continue, and their seed shall stand fast in thy sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul, praise thou the Lord, and all that is within me, praise his holy Name.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul, praise thou the Lord, and forget not all his benefits.
speaker: Narrator

text: Which forgiveth all thine iniquity, and healeth all thine infirmities.
speaker: Narrator

text: Which redeemeth thy life from the grave; and crowneth thee with mercy and compassions.
speaker: Narrator

text: Which satisfieth thy mouth with good things: and thy youth is renewed like the eagleâ€™s.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord executeth righteousness and judgment to all that are oppressed.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made his ways known unto Moses, and his works unto the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is full of compassion and mercy, slow to anger and of great kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will not always chide, neither keep his anger forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath not dealt with us after our sins, nor rewarded us according to our iniquities.
speaker: Narrator

text: For as high as the heaven is above the earth, so great is his mercy toward them that fear him.
speaker: Narrator

text: As far as the East is from the West: so far hath he removed our sins from us.
speaker: Narrator

text: As a father hath compassion on his children, so hath the Lord compassion on them that fear him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he knoweth whereof we be made: he remembereth that we are but dust.
speaker: Narrator

text: The days of man are as grass: as a flower of the field, so flourisheth he.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the wind goeth over it, and it is gone, and the place thereof shall know it no more.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the loving kindness of the Lord endureth forever and ever upon them that fear him, and his righteousness upon childrenâ€™s children,
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto them that keep his covenant, and think upon his commandments to do them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord hath prepared his throne in heaven, and his kingdom ruleth over all.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the Lord, ye his Angels, that excel in strength, that do his commandment in obeying the voice of his word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the Lord all ye his hosts, ye his servants that do his pleasure.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the Lord all ye his works, in all places of his dominion: my soul, praise thou the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul, praise thou the Lord: O Lord my God, thou art exceeding great, thou art clothed with glory and honor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Which covereth himself with light, as with a garment, and spreadeth the heavens like a curtain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Which layeth the beams of his chambers in the waters, and maketh the clouds his chariot, and walketh upon the wings of the wind.
speaker: Narrator

text: Which maketh the spirits his messengers, and a flaming fire his ministers.
speaker: Narrator

text: He set the earth upon her foundations, so that it shall never move.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou coverest it with the deep as with a garment: the waters would stand above the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text: But at thy rebuke they flee: at the voice of thy thunder they haste away.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the mountains ascend, and the valleys descend to the place which thou hast established for them.
