text: They have ears, and hear not: they have noses and smell not.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have hands, and touch not: they have feet, and walk not: neither make they a sound with their throat.
speaker: Narrator

text: They that make them are like unto them: so are all that trust in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Israel, trust thou in the Lord: for he is their help, and their shield.
speaker: Narrator

text: O house of Aaron trust ye in the Lord, for he is their help, and their shield.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye that fear the Lord, trust in the Lord: for he is their helper, and their shield.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord hath been mindful of us, he will bless, he will bless the house of Israel, he will bless the house of Aaron.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will bless them that fear the Lord, both small and great.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will increase his graces toward you, even toward you, and toward your children.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye are blessed of the Lord, which made the heaven and the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heavens, even the heavens are the Lordâ€™s: but he hath given the earth to the sons of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: The dead praise not the Lord, neither any that go down into the place of silence.
speaker: Narrator

text: But we will praise the Lord from henceforth and forever. Praise ye the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: I love the Lord, because he hath heard my voice and my prayers.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he hath inclined his ear unto me, when I did call upon him in my days.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the snares of death compassed me, and the griefs of the grave caught me: When I found trouble and sorrow.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I called upon the Name of the Lord, saying, I beseech thee, O Lord, deliver my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is merciful and righteous, and our God is full of compassion.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord preserveth the simple: I was in misery, and he saved me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Return unto thy rest, O my soul: for the Lord hath been beneficial unto thee,
speaker: Narrator

text: Because thou hast delivered my soul from death, mine eyes from tears, and my feet from falling.
speaker: Narrator

text: I shall walk before the Lord in the land of the living.
speaker: Narrator

text: I believed, therefore did I speak: for I was sore troubled.
speaker: Narrator

text: I said in my fear, All men are liars.
speaker: Narrator

text: What shall I render unto the Lord for all his benefits toward me?
speaker: Narrator

text: I will take the cup of salvation, and call upon the Name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will pay my vows unto the Lord, even now in the presence of all his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Precious in the sight of the Lord is the death of his Saints.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, Lord: for I am thy servant, I am thy servant, and the son of thine handmaid: thou hast broken my bonds.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will offer to thee a sacrifice of praise, and will call upon the Name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will pay my vows unto the Lord, even now in the presence of all his people,
speaker: Narrator

text: In the courts of the Lordâ€™s house, even in the midst of thee, O Jerusalem. Praise ye the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: All nations, praise ye the Lord: all ye people, praise him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For his loving kindness is great toward us, and the truth of the Lord endureth forever. Praise ye the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye the Lord, because he is good: for his mercy endureth forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let Israel now say, That his mercy endureth forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the house of Aaron now say, That his mercy endureth forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them that fear the Lord, now say, That his mercy endureth forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: I called upon the Lord in trouble, and the Lord heard me, and set me at large.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is with me: therefore I will not fear what man can do unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is with me among them that help me: therefore shall I see my desire upon mine enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is better to trust in the Lord, than to have confidence in man.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is better to trust in the Lord, than to have confidence in princes.
speaker: Narrator

text: All nations have compassed me: but in the Name of the Lord shall I destroy them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have compassed me, yea, they have compassed me: but in the Name of the Lord I shall destroy them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They came about me like bees, but they were quenched as a fire of thorns: for in the Name of the Lord I shall destroy them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast thrust sore at me, that I might fall: but the Lord hath helped me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is my strength and song: for he hath been my deliverance.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of joy and deliverance shall be in the tabernacles of the righteous, saying, The right hand of the Lord hath done valiantly.
speaker: Narrator

text: The right hand of the Lord is exalted: the right hand of the Lord hath done valiantly.
speaker: Narrator

text: I shall not die, but live, and declare the works of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord had chastened me sore, but he hath not delivered me to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Open ye unto me the gates of righteousness, that I may go into them, and praise the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the gate of the Lord: the righteous shall enter into it.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will praise thee: for thou hast heard me, and hast been my deliverance.
speaker: Narrator

text: The stone, which the builders refused, is the head of the corner.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was the Lordâ€™s doing, and it is marvelous in our eyes,
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the day, which the Lord hath made: let us rejoice and be glad in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, I pray thee, save now: O Lord, I pray thee now give prosperity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be he, that cometh in the Name of the Lord: we have blessed you out of the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is mighty, and hath given us light: bind the sacrifice with cords unto the horns of the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou art my God, and I will praise thee, even my God: therefore I will exalt thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye the Lord, because he is good: for his mercy endureth forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed are those that are upright in their way, and walk in the Law of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed are they that keep his testimonies, and seek him with their whole heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely they work none iniquity, but walk in his ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast commanded to keep thy precepts diligently.
speaker: Narrator

text: Oh that my ways were directed to keep thy statutes!
speaker: Narrator

text: Then should I not be confounded, when I have respect unto all thy commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will praise thee with an upright heart, when I shall learn the judgments of thy righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will keep thy statutes: forsake me not overlong.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherewith shall a young man redress his way? in taking heed thereto according to thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: With my whole heart have I sought thee: let me not wander from thy commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have hid thy promise in mine heart, that I might not sin against thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed art thou, O Lord: teach me thy statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: With my lips have I declared all the judgments of thy mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have had as great delight in the way of thy testimonies, as in all riches.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will meditate in thy precepts, and consider thy ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will delight in thy statutes, and I will not forget thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be beneficial unto thy servant, that I may live and keep thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Open mine eyes, that I may see the wonders of thy Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am a stranger upon earth: hide not thy commandments from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine heart breaketh for the desire to thy judgments always.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast destroyed the proud: cursed are they that do err from thy commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remove from me shame and contempt: for I have kept thy testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Princes also did sit, and speak against me: but thy servant did meditate in thy statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also thy testimonies are my delight, and my counselors.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul cleaveth to the dust: quicken me according to thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have declared my ways, and thou heardest me: teach me thy statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make me to understand the way of thy precepts, and I will meditate in thy wondrous works.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul melteth for heaviness: raise me up according to thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take from me the way of lying, and grant me graciously thy Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have chosen the way of truth, and thy judgments have I laid before me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have cleaved to thy testimonies, O Lord: confound me not.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will run the way of thy commandments, when thou shalt enlarge mine heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Teach me, O Lord, the way of thy statutes, and I will keep it unto the end.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give me understanding and I will keep thy Law, yea, I will keep it with my whole heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Direct me in the path of thy commandments: for therein is my delight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Incline mine heart unto thy testimonies: and not to covetousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn away mine eyes from regarding vanity, and quicken me in thy way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Stablish thy promise to thy servant, because he feareth thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take away my rebuke that I fear: for thy judgments are good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I desire thy commandments: quicken me in thy righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And let thy loving kindness come unto me, O Lord, and thy salvation according to thy promise.
speaker: Narrator

text: So shall I make answer unto my blasphemers: for I trust in thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: And take not the word of truth utterly out of my mouth: for I wait for thy judgments.
speaker: Narrator

text: So shall I always keep thy Law forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will walk at liberty: for I seek thy precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will speak also of thy testimonies before Kings, and will not be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And my delight shall be in thy Commandments, which I have loved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine hands also will I lift up unto thy Commandments, which I have loved, and I will meditate in thy statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember the promise made to thy servant, wherein thou hast caused me to trust.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is my comfort in my trouble; for thy promise hath quickened me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The proud have had me exceedingly in derision: yet have I not declined from thy Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: I remembered thy judgments of old, O Lord, and have been comforted.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fear is come upon me for the wicked, that forsake thy Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy statutes have been my songs in the house of my pilgrimage.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have remembered thy Name, O Lord, in the night, and have kept thy Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: This I had because I kept thy precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, that art my portion, I have determined to keep thy words.
speaker: Narrator

text: I made my supplication in thy presence with my whole heart: be merciful unto me according to thy promise.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have considered my ways, and turned my feet into thy testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text: I made haste and delayed not to keep thy commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: The bands of the wicked have robbed me: but I have not forgotten thy Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: At midnight will I rise to give thanks unto thee, because of thy righteous judgments.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am companion of all them that fear thee, and keep thy precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text: The earth, O Lord, is full of thy mercy: teach me thy statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, thou hast dealt graciously with thy servant, according unto thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Teach me good judgment and knowledge: for I have believed thy commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: Before I was afflicted, I went astray: but now I keep thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou art good and gracious: teach me thy statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: The proud have imagined a lie against me: but I will keep thy precepts with my whole heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their heart is fat as grease, but my delight is in thy Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is good for me that I have been afflicted, that I may learn thy statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Law of thy mouth is better unto me, than thousands of gold and silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thine hands have made me and fashioned me: give me understanding therefore, that I may learn thy commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they that fear thee, seeing me, shall rejoice, because I have trusted in thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: I know, O Lord, that thy judgments are right, and that thou hast afflicted me justly.
speaker: Narrator

text: I pray thee that thy mercy may comfort me, according to thy promise unto thy servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let thy tender mercies come unto me, that I may live: for thy Law is my delight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the proud be ashamed: for they have dealt wickedly and falsely with me: but I meditate in thy precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let such as fear thee turn unto me, and they that know thy testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let mine heart be upright in thy statutes, that I be not ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul fainted for thy salvation: yet I wait for thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine eyes fail for thy promise, saying, When wilt thou comfort me?
speaker: Narrator

text: For I am like a bottle in the smoke; yet do I not forget thy statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: How many are the days of thy servant? When wilt thou execute judgment on them that persecute me?
speaker: Narrator

text: The proud have dug pits for me, which is not after thy Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: All thy commandments are true: they persecute me falsely: help me.
speaker: Narrator

text: They had almost consumed me upon the earth: but I forsook not thy precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Quicken me according to thy loving kindness: so shall I keep the testimony of thy mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, thy word endureth forever in heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy truth is from generation to generation: thou hast laid the foundation of the earth, and it abideth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They continue even to this day by thine ordinances: for all are thy servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: Except thy law had been my delight, I should now have perished in mine affliction.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will never forget thy precepts: for by them thou hast quickened me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am thine, save me: for I have sought thy precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked have waited for me to destroy me: but I will consider thy testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have seen an end of all perfection: but thy commandment is exceeding large.
speaker: Narrator

text: Oh how love I thy law! it is my meditation continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: By thy commandments thou hast made me wiser than mine enemies: for they are ever with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have had more understanding than all my teachers: for thy testimonies are my meditation.
speaker: Narrator

text: I understood more than the ancient, because I kept thy precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have refrained my feet from every evil way, that I might keep thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have not declined from thy judgments: for thou didst teach me.
speaker: Narrator

text: How sweet are thy promises unto my mouth! yea, more than honey unto my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: By thy precepts I have gotten understanding: therefore I hate all the ways of falsehood.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy word is a lantern unto my feet, and a light unto my paths.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have sworn and will perform it, that I will keep thy righteous judgments.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am very sore afflicted: O Lord, quicken me according to thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, I beseech thee, accept the free offering of my mouth, and teach me thy judgments.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul is continually in mine hand: yet do I not forget thy law.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked have laid a snare for me: but I swerved not from thy precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy testimonies have I taken as an heritage forever: for they are the joy of mine heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have applied mine heart to fulfill thy statutes always, even unto the end.
speaker: Narrator

text: I hate vain inventions: but thy Law do I love.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou art my refuge and shield, and I trust in thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Away from me, ye wicked: for I will keep the commandments of my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Stablish me according to thy promise, that I may live, and disappoint me not of mine hope.
speaker: Narrator

text: Stay thou me, and I shall be safe, and I will delight continually in thy statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast trodden down all them that depart from thy statutes: for their deceit is vain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast taken away all the wicked of the earth like dross: therefore I love thy testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text: My flesh trembleth for fear of thee, and I am afraid of thy judgments.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have executed judgment and justice: leave me not to mine oppressor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Answer for thy servant in that which is good, and let not the proud oppress me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine eyes have failed in waiting for thy salvation, and for thy just promise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deal with thy servant according to thy mercy, and teach me thy statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am thy servant: grant me therefore understanding, that I may know thy testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is time for thee, Lord, to work: for they have destroyed thy Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore love I thy commandments above gold, yea, above most fine gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I esteem all thy precepts most just, and hate all false ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy testimonies are wonderful: therefore doth my soul keep them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The entrance into thy words showeth light, and giveth understanding to the simple.
speaker: Narrator

text: I opened my mouth, and panted, because I loved thy commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look upon me and be merciful unto me, as thou usest to do unto those that love thy Name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Direct my steps in thy word, and let none iniquity have dominion over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver me from the oppression of men, and I will keep thy precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Show the light of thy countenance upon thy servant, and teach me thy statute.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine eyes gush out with rivers of water, because they keep not thy Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Righteous art thou, O Lord, and just are thy judgments.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast commanded justice by thy testimonies and truth especially.
speaker: Narrator

text: My zeal hath even consumed me: because mine enemies have forgotten thy words.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy word is proved most pure, and thy servant loveth it.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am small and despised: yet do I not forget thy precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy righteousness is an everlasting righteousness, and thy Law is truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Trouble and anguish are come upon me: yet are the commandments my delight.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteousness of thy testimonies is everlasting: grant me understanding, and I shall live.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have cried with my whole heart: hear me, O Lord, and I will keep thy statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: I called upon thee: save me, and I will keep thy testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text: I prevented the morning light, and cried: for I waited on thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine eyes prevent the night watches, to meditate in thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear my voice according to thy loving kindness: O Lord, quicken me according to thy judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: They draw near that follow after malice, and are far from thy Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou art near, O Lord: for all thy commandments are true.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have known long since by thy testimonies, that thou hast established them forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold mine affliction, and deliver me: for I have not forgotten thy law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Plead my cause, and deliver me: quicken me according unto thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Salvation is far from the wicked, because they seek not thy statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Great art thy tender mercies, O Lord: quicken me according to thy judgments.
speaker: Narrator

text: My persecutors and mine oppressors are many: yet do I not swerve from thy testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text: I saw the transgressors and was grieved, because they kept not thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Consider, O Lord, how I love thy precepts: quicken me according to thy loving kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The beginning of thy word is truth, and all the judgments of thy righteousness endure forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Princes have persecuted me without cause: but mine heart stood in awe of thy words.
speaker: Narrator

text: I rejoice at thy word, as one that findeth a great spoil.
speaker: Narrator

text: I hate falsehood and abhor it, but thy Law do I love.
speaker: Narrator

text: Seven times a day do I praise thee, because of thy righteous judgments.
speaker: Narrator

text: They that love thy law, shall have great prosperity, and they shall have none hurt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, I have trusted in thy salvation, and have done thy commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul hath kept thy testimonies: for I love them exceedingly.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have kept thy precepts and thy testimonies: for all my ways are before thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let my complaint come before thee, O Lord, and give me understanding according unto thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let my supplication come before thee, and deliver me according to thy promise.
speaker: Narrator

text: My lips shall speak praise, when thou hast taught me thy statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: My tongue shall entreat of thy word: for all thy commandments are righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let thine hand help me: for I have chosen thy precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have longed for thy salvation, O Lord, and thy Law is my delight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let my soul live, and it shall praise thee, and thy judgments shall help me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have gone astray like a lost sheep: seek thy servant, for I do not forget thy commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: I called unto the Lord in my trouble, and he heard me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver my soul, O Lord, from lying lips, and from a deceitful tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text: What doth thy deceitful tongue bring unto thee? or what doth it avail thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: It is as the sharp arrows of a mighty man, and as the coals of Juniper.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe is to me that I remain in Meshech, and dwell in the tents of Kedar.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul hath too long dwelt with him that hateth peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: I seek peace, and when I speak thereof, they are bent to war.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will lift up mine eyes unto the mountains, from whence my help shall come.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine help cometh from the Lord, which hath made the heaven and the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will not suffer thy foot to slip: for he that keepeth thee, will not slumber.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, he that keepeth Israel, will neither slumber nor sleep.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is thy keeper: the Lord is thy shadow at thy right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sun shall not smite thee by day, nor the moon by night.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord shall preserve thee from all evil: he shall keep thy soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord shall preserve thy going out, and thy coming in from henceforth and forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: I rejoiced when they said to me, We will go into the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our feet shall stand in thy gates, O Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jerusalem is built as a city, that is compact together in itself:
speaker: Narrator

text: Whereunto the Tribes, even the Tribes of the Lord go up according to the testimony to Israel, to praise the Name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For there are thrones set for judgment, even the thrones of the house of David.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pray for the peace of Jerusalem: let them prosper that love thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peace be within thy walls, and prosperity within thy palaces.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my brethren and neighborsâ€™ sakes, I will wish thee now prosperity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because of the House of the Lord our God, I will procure thy wealth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I lift up mine eyes to thee, that dwellest in the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, as the eyes of servants look unto the hand of their masters, and as the eyes of a maiden unto the hand of her mistress: so our eyes wait upon the Lord our God, until he have mercy upon us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have mercy unto us, O Lord, have mercy upon us: for we have suffered too much contempt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our soul is filled too full of the mocking of the wealthy, and of the despitefulness of the proud.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the Lord had not been on our side, (may Israel now say)
speaker: Narrator

text: If the Lord had [not] been on our side, when men rose up against us,
speaker: Narrator

text: They had then swallowed us up quick, when their wrath was kindled against us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the waters had drowned us, and the stream had gone over our soul:
speaker: Narrator

text: Then had the swelling waters gone over our soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praised be the Lord, which hath not given us as a prey unto their teeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our soul is escaped, even as a bird out of the snare of the fowlers: the snare is broken, and we are delivered.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our help is in the Name of the Lord, which hath made heaven and earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They that trust in the Lord, shall be as mount Zion, which cannot be removed, but remaineth forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the mountains are about Jerusalem: so is the Lord about his people from henceforth and forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the rod of the wicked shall not rest on the lot of the righteous, lest the righteous put forth their hand unto wickedness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do well, O Lord, unto those that be good and true in their hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text: But these that turn aside by their crooked ways, them shall the Lord lead with the workers of iniquity: but peace shall be upon Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Lord brought again the captivity of Zion, we were like them that dream.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then was our mouth filled with laughter, and our tongue with joy: then said they among the heathen, The Lord hath done great things for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord hath done great things for us, whereof we rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, bring again our captivity, as the rivers in the South.
speaker: Narrator

text: They that sow in tears, shall reap in joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went weeping, and carried precious seed: but they shall return with joy, and bring their sheaves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Except the Lord build the house, they labor in vain that build it: except the Lord keep the city, the keeper watcheth in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is in vain for you to rise early, and to lie down late, and eat the bread of sorrow: but he will surely give rest to his beloved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, children are the inheritance of the Lord, and the fruit of the womb his reward.
speaker: Narrator

text: As are the arrows in the hand of the strong man; so are the children of youth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is the man that hath his quiver full of them: for they shall not be ashamed, when they speak with their enemies in the gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is everyone that feareth the Lord, and walketh in his ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou eatest the labors of thine hands, thou shalt be blessed, and it shall be well with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy wife shall be as the fruitful vine on the sides of thine house, and thy children like the olive plants round about thy table.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lo, surely thus shall the man be blessed, that feareth the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord out of Zion shall bless thee, and thou shalt see the wealth of Jerusalem all the days of thy life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, thou shalt see thy childrenâ€™s children, and peace upon Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have oftentimes afflicted me from my youth (may Israel now say)
speaker: Narrator

text: They have oftentimes afflicted me from my youth: but they could not prevail against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The plowers plowed upon my back, and made long furrows.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the righteous Lord hath cut the cords of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: They that hate Zion, shall be all ashamed and turned backward.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall be as the grass on the house tops, which withereth afore it cometh forth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whereof the mower filleth not his hand, neither the gleaner his lap:
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither they which go by, say, The blessing of the Lord be upon you, or, We bless you in the Name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of the deep places have I called unto thee, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, hear my voice: let thine ears attend to the voice of my prayers.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou, O Lord, straightly markest iniquities, O Lord, who shall stand?
speaker: Narrator

text: But mercy is with thee, that thou mayest be feared.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have waited on the Lord: my soul hath waited, and I have trusted in his word.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul waiteth on the Lord more than the morning watch watcheth for the morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let Israel wait on the Lord: for with the Lord is mercy, and with him is great redemption.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, mine heart is not haughty, neither are mine eyes lofty, neither have I walked in great matters and hid from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely I have behaved myself, like one weaned from his mother, and kept silence: I am in myself as one that is weaned.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let Israel wait on the Lord from henceforth and forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, remember David with all his affliction,
speaker: Narrator

text: Who sware unto the Lord, and vowed unto the mighty God, of Jacob, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: I will not enter into the Tabernacle of mine house, nor come upon my pallet or bed,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nor suffer mine eyes to sleep, nor mine eyelids to slumber,
speaker: Narrator

text: Until I find out a place for the Lord, an habitation for the mighty God of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lo, we heard of it in Ephrathah, and found it in the fields of the forest.
speaker: Narrator

text: We will enter into his Tabernacles, and worship before his footstool.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, O Lord, to come into thy rest, thou, and the Ark of thy strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let thy Priests be clothed with righteousness, and let thy Saints rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thy servant Davidâ€™s sake refuse not the face of thine Anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord hath sworn in truth unto David, and he will not shrink from it, saying, Of the fruit of thy body will I set upon thy throne.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thy sons keep my Covenant, and my testimonies, that I shall teach them, their sons also shall sit upon thy throne forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord hath chosen Zion, and loved to dwell in it, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: This is my rest forever: here will I dwell, for I have a delight therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will surely bless her vittles, and will satisfy her poor with bread,
speaker: Narrator

text: And will clothe her Priests with salvation, and her Saints shall shout for joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: There will I make the horn of David to bud: for I have ordained a light for mine Anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text: His enemies will I clothe with shame, but on him his crown shall flourish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, how good and how comely a thing it is, brethren to dwell even together.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is like to the precious ointment upon the head, that runneth down upon the beard, even unto Aaronâ€™s beard, which went down on the border of his garments,
speaker: Narrator

text: And as the dew of Hermon which falleth upon the mountains of Zion: for there the Lord appointed the blessing and life forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, praise ye the Lord, all ye servants of the Lord, ye that by night stand in the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up your hands to the Sanctuary, and praise the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord that hath made heaven and earth, bless thee out of Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise, the Name of the Lord; ye servants of the Lord, praise him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye that stand in the House of the Lord, and in the courts of the House of our God,
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye the Lord: for the Lord is good: sing praises unto his Name: for it is a comely thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord hath chosen Jacob to himself, and Israel for his chief treasure.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I know that the Lord is great, and that our Lord is above all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whatsoever pleased the Lord, that did he in heaven and in earth, in the sea, and in all the depths.
speaker: Narrator

text: He bringeth up the clouds from the ends of the earth, and maketh the lightnings with the rain: he draweth forth the wind out of his treasures.
speaker: Narrator

text: He smote the firstborn of Egypt both of man and beast.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath sent tokens and wonders into the midst of thee, O Egypt, upon Pharaoh, and upon all his servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: He smote many nations, and slew mighty Kings:
speaker: Narrator

text: As Sihon King of the Amorites, and Og king of Bashan, and all the kingdoms of Canaan:
speaker: Narrator

text: And gave their land for an inheritance, even an inheritance unto Israel his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy Name, O Lord, endureth forever: O Lord, thy remembrance is from generation to generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord will judge his people, and be pacified toward his servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: The idols of the heathen are silver and gold, even the work of menâ€™s hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have a mouth, and speak not: they have eyes and see not.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have ears and hear not, neither is there any breath in their mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They that make them, are like unto them: so are all that trust in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the Lord, ye house of Israel: praise the Lord, ye house of Aaron.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the Lord, ye house of Levi; ye that fear the Lord, praise the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praised be the Lord out of Zion, which dwelleth in Jerusalem. Praise ye the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye the Lord, because he is good: for his mercy endureth forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye the God of gods: for his mercy endureth forever:
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye the Lord of lords: for his mercy endureth forever:
speaker: Narrator

text: Which only doeth great wonders; for his mercy endureth forever:
speaker: Narrator

text: Which by his wisdom made the heavens: for his mercy endureth forever:
speaker: Narrator

text: Which hath stretched out the earth upon the waters: for his mercy endureth forever:
speaker: Narrator

text: Which made great lights: for his mercy endureth forever:
speaker: Narrator

text: As the Sun to rule the day; for his mercy endureth forever:
speaker: Narrator

text: The Moon and the stars to govern the night: for his mercy endureth forever:
speaker: Narrator

text: Which smote Egypt with their firstborn, (for his mercy endureth forever)
speaker: Narrator

text: And brought out Israel from among them; for his mercy endureth forever:
speaker: Narrator

text: With a mighty hand and stretched out arm; for his mercy endureth forever:
speaker: Narrator

text: Which divideth the Sea into two parts; for his mercy endureth forever:
speaker: Narrator

text: And made Israel to pass through the midst of it; for his mercy endureth forever:
speaker: Narrator

text: And overthrew Pharaoh and his host in the red Sea; for his mercy endureth forever:
speaker: Narrator

text: Which led his people through the wilderness; for his mercy endureth forever:
speaker: Narrator

text: Which smote great Kings: for his mercy endureth forever:
speaker: Narrator

text: And slew mighty Kings: for his mercy endureth forever:
speaker: Narrator

text: As Sihon King of the Amorites: for his mercy endureth forever:
speaker: Narrator

text: And Og the king of Bashan: for his mercy endureth forever:
speaker: Narrator

text: And gave their land for an heritage; for his mercy endureth forever:
speaker: Narrator

text: Even an heritage unto Israel his servant; for his mercy endureth forever:
speaker: Narrator

text: Which remembered us in our base estate; for his mercy endureth forever:
speaker: Narrator

text: And hath rescued us from our oppressors; for his mercy endureth forever:
speaker: Narrator

text: Which giveth food to all flesh; for his mercy endureth forever:
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye the God of heaven; for his mercy endureth forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: By the rivers of Babel we sat, and there we wept, when we remembered Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: We hanged our harps upon the willows in the midst thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they that led us captive, required of us songs and mirth, when we had hanged up our harps, saying, Sing us one of the songs of Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: How shall we sing, said we, a song of the Lord in a strange land?
speaker: Narrator

text: If I forget thee, O Jerusalem, let my right hand forget to play.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I do not remember thee, let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth: yea, if I prefer not Jerusalem to my chief joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember the children of Edom, O Lord, in the day of Jerusalem, which said, Raze it, raze it to the foundation thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: O daughter of Babel, worthy to be destroyed, blessed shall he be that rewardeth thee, as thou hast served us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed shall he be that taketh and dasheth thy children against the stones.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will praise thee with my whole heart: even before the gods will I praise thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will worship toward thine holy Temple and praise thy Name, because of thy loving-kindness and for thy truth: for thou hast magnified thy Name above all things by thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I called, then thou heardest me, and hast increased strength in my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the kings of the earth shall praise thee, O Lord: for they have heard the words of thy mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall sing of the ways of the Lord, because the glory of the Lord is great.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord is high, yet he beholdeth the lowly, but the proud he knoweth afar off.
speaker: Narrator

text: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, yet wilt thou revive me: thou wilt stretch forth thine hand upon the wrath of mine enemies, and thy right hand shall save me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will perform his work toward me: O Lord, thy mercy endureth forever: forsake not the works of thine hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, thou hast tried me, and known me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou knowest my sitting and my rising: thou understandest my thought afar off.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou compassest my paths, and my lying down, and art accustomed to all my ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: For there is not a word in my tongue, but lo, thou knowest it wholly, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou holdest me strait behind and before, and layest thine hand upon me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy knowledge is too wonderful for me: it is so high that I cannot attain unto it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whither shall I go from thy Spirit? or whither shall I flee from thy presence?
speaker: Narrator

text: If I ascend into heaven, thou art there: if I lie down in hell, thou art there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let me take the wings of the morning, and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea:
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet thither shall thine hand lead me, and thy right hand hold me.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I say, Yet the darkness shall hide me, even the night shall be light about me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, the darkness hideth not from thee: but the night shineth as the day: the darkness and light are both alike.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou hast possessed my reins: thou hast covered me in my motherâ€™s womb.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will praise thee, for I am fearfully and wondrously made: marvelous are thy works, and my soul knoweth it well.
speaker: Narrator

text: My bones are not hid from thee, though I was made in a secret place, and fashioned beneath in the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thine eyes did see me, when I was without form: for in thy book were all things written, which in continuance were fashioned, when there was none of them before.
speaker: Narrator

text: How dear therefore are thy thoughts unto me, O God! how great is the sum of them!
speaker: Narrator

text: If I should count them, they are more than the sand: when I awake, I am still with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Oh that thou wouldest [slay], O God, the wicked and bloody men, to whom I say, Depart ye from me:
speaker: Narrator

text: Which speak wickedly of thee, and being thine enemies are lifted up in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not I hate them, O Lord, that hate thee? and do not I earnestly contend with those that rise up against thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: I hate them with an unfeigned hatred, as they were mine utter enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Try me, O God, and know mine heart: prove me and know my thoughts,
speaker: Narrator

text: And consider if there be any way of wickedness in me, and lead me in the way forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver me, O Lord, from the evil man: preserve me from the cruel man:
speaker: Narrator

text: Which imagine evil things in their heart, and make war continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent: addersâ€™ poison is under their lips. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep me, O Lord, from the hands of the wicked; preserve me from the cruel man, which purposeth to cause my steps to slide.
speaker: Narrator

text: The proud have laid a snare for me, and spread a net with cords in my pathway, and set gins for me. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I said unto the Lord, Thou art my God: hear, O Lord, the voice of my prayers.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord God the strength of my salvation, thou hast covered my head in the day of battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let not the wicked have his desire, O Lord; perform not his wicked thought, lest they be proud. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for the chief of them that compass me about, let the mischief of their own lips come upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let coals fall upon them: let him cast them into the fire, and into the deep pits that they rise not.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the backbiter shall not be established upon the earth, evil shall hunt the cruel man to destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: I know that the Lord will avenge the afflicted, and judge the poor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely the righteous shall praise thy Name, and the just shall dwell in thy presence.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, I call upon thee: haste thee unto me: hear my voice, when I cry unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let my prayer be directed in thy sight as incense, and the lifting up of mine hands as an evening sacrifice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Set a watch, O Lord, before my mouth, and keep the door of my lips.
speaker: Narrator

text: Incline not mine heart to evil, that I should commit wicked works with them that work iniquity: and let me not eat of their delicates.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the righteous smite me: for that is a benefit: and let him reprove me, and it shall be a precious oil that shall not break mine head: for within a while I shall even pray in their miseries.
speaker: Narrator

text: When their judges shall be cast down in stony places, they shall hear my words, for they are sweet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our bones lie scattered at the graveâ€™s mouth, as he that heweth wood or diggeth in the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: But mine eyes look unto thee, O Lord God: in thee is my trust: leave not my soul destitute.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep me from the snare, which they have laid for me, and from the gins of the workers of iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the wicked fall into his nets together, while I escape.
speaker: Narrator

text: I cried unto the Lord with my voice: with my voice I prayed unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: I poured out my meditation before him, and declared mine affection in his presence.
speaker: Narrator

text: Though my spirit was in perplexity in me, yet thou knewest my path: in the way wherein I walked, have they privily laid a snare for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I looked upon my right hand, and beheld, but there was none that would know me: all refuge failed me, and none cared for my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then cried I unto thee, O Lord, and said, Thou art mine hope, and my portion in the land of the living.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hearken unto my cry, for I am brought very low: deliver me from my persecutors, for they are too strong for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bring my soul out of prison, that I may praise thy Name: then shall the righteous come about me, when thou art beneficial unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear my prayer, O Lord, and hearken unto my supplication: answer me in thy truth, and in thy righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: (And enter not into judgment with thy servant: for in thy sight shall none that liveth, be justified.)
speaker: Narrator

text: For the enemy hath persecuted my soul: he hath smitten my life down to the earth: he hath laid me in the darkness, as they that have been dead long ago:
speaker: Narrator

text: And my spirit was in perplexity in me, and mine heart within me was amazed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet do I remember the time past: I meditate in all thy works, yea, I do meditate in the works of thine hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: I stretch forth mine hands unto thee: my soul desireth after thee, as the thirsty land. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear me speedily, O Lord, for my spirit faileth: hide not thy face from me, else I shall be like unto them that go down into the pit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let me hear thy loving-kindness in the morning, for in thee is my trust; show me the way, that I should walk in, for I lift up my soul unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver me, O Lord, from mine enemies: for I hid me with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Teach me to do thy will, for thou art my God: let thy good Spirit lead me unto the land of righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Quicken me, O Lord, for thy Nameâ€™s sake, and for thy righteousness bring my soul out of trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: And for thy mercy slay mine enemies, and destroy all them that oppress my soul: for I am thy servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be the Lord my strength, which teacheth mine hands to fight, and my fingers to battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is my goodness and my fortress, my tower and my deliverer, my shield and in him I trust, which subdueth my people under me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, what is man that thou regardest him! or the son of man that thou thinkest upon him?
speaker: Narrator

text: Man is like to vanity; his days are like a shadow that vanisheth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bow thine heavens, O Lord, and come down; touch the mountains, and they shall smoke.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cast forth the lightning and scatter them; shoot out thine arrows and consume them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Send thine hand from above: deliver me, and take me out of the great waters, and from the hand of strangers,
speaker: Narrator

text: Whose mouth talketh vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will sing a new song unto thee, O God, and sing unto thee upon a viol, and an instrument of ten strings.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is he that giveth deliverance unto kings, and rescueth David his servant from the hurtful sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rescue me, and deliver me from the hand of strangers, whose mouth talketh vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood:
speaker: Narrator

text: That our sons may be as the plants growing up in their youth, and our daughters as the corner stones, graven after the similitude of a palace:
speaker: Narrator

text: That our corners may be full and abounding with divers sorts, and that our sheep may bring forth thousands and ten thousand in our streets.
speaker: Narrator

text: That our oxen may be strong to labor; that there be none invasion, nor going out, nor no crying in our streets.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed are the people, that be so, yea blessed are the people whose God is the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: O my God and King, I will extol thee, and will bless thy Name forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will bless thee daily, and praise thy Name forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Great is the Lord, and most worthy to be praised, and his greatness is incomprehensible.
speaker: Narrator

text: Generation shall praise thy works unto generation, and declare thy power.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will meditate of the beauty of thy glorious majesty, and thy wonderful works.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall speak of the power of thy dreadful acts, and I will declare thy greatness.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall break out into the mention of thy great goodness, and shall sing aloud of thy righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is gracious, and merciful, slow to anger, and of great mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is good to all, and his mercies are over all his works.
speaker: Narrator

text: All thy works praise thee, O Lord, and thy Saints bless thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: They show the glory of thy kingdom, and speak of thy power,
speaker: Narrator

text: To cause his power to be known to the sons of men, and the glorious renown of his kingdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and thy dominion endureth throughout all ages.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord upholdeth all that fall, and lifteth up all that are ready to fall.
speaker: Narrator

text: The eyes of all wait upon thee, and thou givest them their meat in due season.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou openest thine hand, and fillest all things living of thy good pleasure.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is righteous in all his ways, and holy in all his works.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is near unto all that call upon him, yea, to all that call upon him in truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will fulfill the desire of them that fear him; he will also hear their cry, and will save them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord preserveth all them that love him; but he will destroy the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: My mouth shall speak the praise of the Lord, and all flesh shall bless his holy Name forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise thou the Lord, O my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will praise the Lord during my life; as long as I have any being, I will sing unto my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Put not your trust in Princes, nor in the son of man, for there is no help in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: His breath departeth, and he returneth to his earth; then his thoughts perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is he that hath the God of Jacob for his help, whose hope is in the Lord his God,
speaker: Narrator

text: Which made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that therein is; which keepeth his fidelity forever,
speaker: Narrator

text: Which executeth justice for the oppressed, which giveth bread to the hungry; the Lord looseth the prisoners.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord giveth sight to the blind: the Lord raiseth up the crooked: the Lord loveth the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord keepeth the strangers: he relieveth the fatherless and widow: but he overthroweth the way of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord shall reign forever: O Zion, thy God endureth from generation to generation. Praise ye the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye the Lord, for it is good to sing unto our God: for it is a pleasant thing, and praise is comely.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord doth build up Jerusalem, and gather together the dispersed of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: He healeth those that are broken in heart, and bindeth up their sores.
speaker: Narrator

text: He counteth the number of the stars, and calleth them all by their names.
speaker: Narrator

text: Great is our Lord, and great is his power: his wisdom is infinite.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord relieveth the meek, and abaseth the wicked to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing unto the Lord with praise: sing upon the harp unto our God,
speaker: Narrator

text: Which covereth the heaven with clouds, and prepareth rain for the earth, and maketh the grass to grow upon the mountains:
speaker: Narrator

text: Which giveth to beasts their food, and to the young ravens that cry.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath no pleasure in the strength of an horse, neither delighteth he in the legs of man.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord delighteth in them that fear him, and attend upon his mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the Lord, O Jerusalem: praise thy God, O Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he hath made the bars of the gates strong, and hath blessed thy children within thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: He setteth peace in thy borders, and satisfieth thee with the flour of wheat.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sendeth forth his commandment upon earth, and his word runneth very swiftly.
speaker: Narrator

text: He giveth snow like wool, and scattereth the hoary frost like ashes.
speaker: Narrator

text: He casteth forth his ice like morsels: who can abide the cold thereof?
speaker: Narrator

text: He sendeth his word and melteth them: he causeth his wind to blow, and the waters flow.
speaker: Narrator

text: He showeth his word unto Jacob, his statutes and his judgments unto Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath not dealt so with every nation, neither have they known his judgments. Praise ye the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye the Lord from the heaven: praise ye him in the high places.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye him, all ye his Angels: praise him, all his army.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye him, sun and moon: praise ye him all bright stars.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye him heavens of heavens, and waters, that be above the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them praise the Name of the Lord: for he commanded, and they were created.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he hath established them forever and ever: he hath made an ordinance, which shall not pass.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye the Lord from the earth, ye dragons and all depths:
speaker: Narrator

text: Fire and hail, snow and vapors, stormy wind, which execute his word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mountains and all hills, fruitful trees, and all cedars:
speaker: Narrator

text: Beasts and all cattle, creeping things and feathered fowls:
speaker: Narrator

text: Kings of the earth and all people, princes and all judges of the world:
speaker: Narrator

text: Young men and maidens, also old men and children:
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them praise the Name of the Lord: for his Name only is to be exalted, and his praise above the earth and the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he hath exalted the horn of his people, which is a praise for all his Saints, even for the children of Israel, a people that is near unto him. Praise ye the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing ye unto the Lord a new song: let his praise be heard in the Congregation of Saints.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let Israel rejoice in him that made him, and let the children of Zion rejoice in their King.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them praise his Name with the flute: let them sing praises unto him with the timbrel and harp.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord hath pleasure in his people: he will make the meek glorious by deliverance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the Saints be joyful with glory: let them sing loud upon their beds.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the high Acts of God be in their mouth, and a two edged sword in their hands,
speaker: Narrator

text: To execute vengeance upon the heathen, and corrections among the people:
speaker: Narrator

text: To bind their kings in chains, and their nobles with fetters of iron,
speaker: Narrator

text: That they may execute upon them the judgment that is written: this honor shall be to all his Saints. Praise ye the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye God in his Sanctuary: praise ye him in the firmament of his power.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye him in his mighty Acts: praise ye him according to his excellent greatness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye him in the sound of the trumpet: praise ye him upon the viol and the harp.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye him with timbrel and flute: praise ye him with virginals and organs.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye him with sounding cymbals: praise ye him with high sounding cymbals.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let everything that hath breath praise the Lord. Praise ye the Lord.
speaker: Narrator
